Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: sfo2mnl
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here with my family and the accommodations could not have been better. We had the 2 bedroom suite with a patio deck located right below the Ghirardelli sign. The room faced San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz and we spent some good time on the patio just enjoying the view. The room was well equipped with a kitchen, a large LCD tv, plenty of seating for the family and a gas fireplace that came in handy. When we weren't in the room, we explored the surrounding Fisherman's Wharf area - mainly to eat at the In and Out burger and the ice cream shop located in Ghirardelli Square. We're from the Bay Area so staying here was a treat - it was a new and very luxurious perspective of the place we call home. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore1954
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It's located right in Ghirardelli Square with great views of San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz. Fisherman's Wharf is right down the street. The hotel staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. Our "room" was unbelievable. "Room" is in quotes because we were upgraded at no extra charge to a two bedroom, 2 1/2 bath suite with a full kitchen, dining area, living room, and washer and dryer. The hotel offers free bicycles, and except for one good-sized hill, the bike path to the Golden Gate Bridge was very easy. Complimentary cheese and wine were served every late afternoon, and the free continental breakfast was outstanding. However one of the best things the hotel had to offer was a free car service. If the car was available, a very nice Cadillac Escalade, one of the butlers will drive you anywhere you want within a two mile radius of the hotel, and you can call them to pick you up! The hotel staff was careful to remind us that the car service was first come, first served, but we never had a problem getting a ride whenever we needed one, which was several times over the course of our 3-day stay. A fantastic service. The Fairmont is a spectacular hotel in a great location and we will definitely want stay again when we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location to explore San Francisco & stay in style”
Reviews.Author: roxhills
Reviews.Content: Three generations (grandparent, parents & elementary school age kids) spend a wonderful weekend at this property. The residence is beautifully appointed and spacious. The views are spectacular. Everyone had enough space to live comfortably. The breakfast every morning is nice and just what we needed to start the day. The location is great, especially if you are traveling with kids & want to be near tourist attractions. My 5 year old sprinted up the steep streets to the top of Lombard. The cable car turn around is just down the street from the hotel. We used the hotel car a few times to take us short distances but we had a car as well, which we used to go to Golden Gate Park, Berkeley & the Marin Headlands. The concierge staff was super helpful, as were the drivers. We really enjoyed staying at this property and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in S.F.!”
Reviews.Author: lucky18
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of the Fairmont Heritage Place is excellent. Everyone is so helpful! The townhomes are beautiful. I cannot find one thing upon which to improve. I only wish that we could return soon.

Reviews.Title: “This place was made for Moms!”
Reviews.Author: jgw W
Reviews.Content: Every time we travel as a family I have the same dilemma--if we rent a home or apartment everyone has there own space & we have the convenience of a kitchen and laundry, but the flip side of that is that I don't really feel like I get a vacation--I'm still preparing meals, tidying up after people (even more so when we're not in our own home), and doing laundry. If we stay at a hotel I actually get a break, but chances are we are on top of one another, & eating out every meal, which isn't optimal either. The Fairmont Heritage Place is the best of both worlds. Adults and kids had their own bedrooms and bathrooms, we had a very serviceable kitchen, but the twice daily housekeeping service, concierge, and friendly staff waiting to attend to any request had us feeling pampered and rested. The rooms are all equipped with ipads which makes for easy checking of the weather and any other web-based research you want to do when planning your day. Hailey got our vacation off to a great start with a warm greeting, easy check-in, and tour of the property. We rented a car which really wasn't necessary. The house car can get you almost anywhere you need to go, and the staff will get you a taxi if your destination is farther away. If you have a daughter you must take her to "The crown & crumpet" for tea in the square--that was a great experience, and of course fisherman's wharf, alcatraz, and Pier 39 are all within walking distance or a short car ride away. I'm sure you will love it here as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: fredoflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square recently for a long vacation weekend. What a wonderfully perfect experience. The staff is helpful (picked us some great restaurants for our stay - as if they knew us and knew just what we would like); knowledgeable about San Francisco and so pleasant. Would definitely stay again and again. Thank you Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCastle
Reviews.Content: Located in Ghirardelli square this is the premier destination for any traveler. The service is amazing and they have very good drivers for the housecar. All staff is extremely polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay period!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: 1st time visit and clearly not our last. There is a reason that it rates so high ... service,service and service. Very friendly, attentive and helpful. Our room was perfect, our view was spectacular and with all amenities so close, what else could you ask for. The patio with fireplace was a great way to unwind and relax, the brakfast had great variety and was very fresh. The pictures you will see only tell 1/2 the story, imagine standing on your balcony a nice glass of pinot in your hand overlooking the water, alcatraz just off in the distance with a soft fresh breeze blowing. Just can't beat it. Spend the money, you will not regret it

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: cherylrector
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here in December 2010, and loved it so much we were back for Feb 2012. The staff truly trip over themselves to ensure you have everything you need, want and are satisfied. We were more than satisfied! We stayed over the Presidents Day weekend, and unfortunately, the building we were in (The Chocolate Building) had a power outage, but they were able to get the power company to hook up a generator to power the building. There is a grocery store not far from the hotel (probably a 15 minute walk, or a $5 cab ride back to the hotel) and we cooked in the suite each night. The appliances are top of the line (Wolf range). There is plenty of seating area around the dining table. There is a freezer, smallish drawer fridge, and a dishwasher in each suite. The location can't be beat - and the shuttle car they offer will take you within a 2 mile radius, which is perfect to get where you need to go. The Hyde Street cable car end-of-the-line is across the street from the square, and Fisherman's Wharf is an easy stroll from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a Hotel - but you'd never know!”
Reviews.Author: timothy4
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Heritage is the serviced apartment concept taken to the highest level. We were upgraded from a two bedroom to a three bedroom which was most pleasant. The apartment was vast and the quality of the fit-out was top notch. It had been exceptionally well maintained. The kitchen had every convenience one would have wanted. The breakfast was brilliant - it is safe to say it was the best "continental breakfast" we have ever had - pity there were not more tables and chairs at peak times though. Front desk staff were excellent and equal to any 5 star hotel. As for location, if your are a tourist in San Francisco there is no better place - even to get to the main shopping areas such as Union Square it is so easy and such fun by cable car. But if I was here on business I would definitely stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kmart
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful weekend in SF at the Fairmont Heritage Place. We felt like we had our own city apartment with our 2 BR/ 2 BA suite. We did not have a great view as we opted for the city view, as it was quite a bit cheaper, but the room was great.plus right outside our door was the Mustard terrace with it's fire pits and panoramic view of the bay. I had called ahead and requested a one king BR and two bed BR configuration, which they were able to give us. The front desk staff/concierges were very helpful.The living room also had a pull out couch, but it was nice for each of my teenagers to have their own bed. Another nice feature was a loaded IPad, with helpful travel, restaurant etc information.the kitchen was well fitted with all apliances and anything you might need down to a cocktail shaker. The continental breakfast was delicious with lots of fresh berries, yogurt, cottage cheese, bagels and other pastry items. My only minor complaint is that the walls are a bit thin and we could hear some door slamming and heavy footsteps and voices above us. All in all though, we had a wonderful stay and look forward to when we can return!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ccs_007
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. We chose it because of the reviews we saw here in Tripadvisor and were really happy to do so. The rooms are great as well as the location. The assistance from the concierge was always very good. The gym is very small, not very good really, but you can go jogging/walking/biking from the hotel to the base of the Golden State Bridge by a beautiful trail (ask for the map at the concierge). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious base to explore San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jaynic
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 enjoyed our stay in a 2 bedroom apartment. The beds were extremely comfortable. We had 2 bathrooms, one with shower over the bath ,the other with separate deep bath. Towels and toiletries were of a very high standard. Plush robes were a nice touch. Kitchen very well equipped, even had martini glasses! I made good use of the washing machine and dryer. Kids loved the Ghiradelli chocolates at turndown and in lobby. Sofa bed seemed uncomfortable and fridge was very noisy, but my 10 yr old coped OK. Breakfast had a good range of items and pastries were fresh and delicious. We enjoyed having a glass of wine and cheese in the afternoon. Sunset views from outside terrace with fire pit were stunning. We borrowed DVDs , there were 800 to choose from! This was an expensive stay for us but worth it for the location and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay as a family”
Reviews.Author: vish86
Reviews.Content: A Fairmont stay is always a fantastic experience and this was no exception. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment, very spacious rooms, well equipped kitchen and fantastic amenities. Excellent location with a fabulous view. Loved the small shops around the square and the lovely sitting area with the fireplace on the terrace was lovely to sit in the evenings and relax. Loved it and would love to go back just to stay at the fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Spottyonetwo
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at this hotel. Check in was prompt and efficient. We had a two bedroom suite on the 4th floor. Nice living area with fireplace and music system. Fairly large kitchen area with all amenities necessary including coffee machine and coffee with creamer. The bedrooms were both on-suite though the smaller room only had a shower but this was perfect for me. Comfortable beds made for a good nights sleep. We had no view - but seeing as we were never there during the day, this didn't matter to us. Breakfast in the lounge downstairs was good. Coffee, tea and juices. Pastries, bread, bagels with toppings, fruit and yogurts made this more than sufficient. Afternoon cocktail hour was also very pleasant with wines, crackers and cheese. The only problem I had with this hotel was the lack of cleanliness! in our room.Housekeeping failed to properly maintain the room - never bothered to straighten the one bed that was not used, and I had the feeling that the towels that were placed on the floor for changing, were just folded and put back in place. However, that could have just been one lazy housekeeper, and so bearing that in mind, I would return to the Fairmont Heritage Place.i The location - at Fisherman's Wharf is really great, within walking distance to the Wharf itself and numerous shops and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: mjpino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this amazing hotel for 3 nights during our California honeymoon. They upgraded us to a 2-bedroom, 2 bathroom condo with a full kitchen, fireplace and unbelievable views of San Francisco Bay & Alcatraz. The hotel is a 5-minute walk to the famous Fisherman's Wharf where you'll enjoy some of the best food you've ever had. The hotel has a car service, which we took advantage of since we're from Florida and not used to all of the hills. They served a complimentary continental breakfast and had a wine & cheese hour each day. This hotel made our first trip to San Francisco extra special and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “best in SF”
Reviews.Author: Dainis K
Reviews.Content: We have been several times in SF and have stayed in many hotels. This was excellent experience. Professional and helpful staff, nice location. As visitors from Europe we would rate this place as real 5 star hotel, if you wish to have kitchen, bicycles for city tour, transfer within 3 km range, complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and wine, internet. And, surprisingly for USA hotels, all above mentioned - included in your room rate. There is nice wine shop in Ghirardelli Square with good quality wines. Be sure to mention your guest status to receive discount. Definitely this would be place I would recommend this place for all kind of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A 100% JEWEL”
Reviews.Author: OhioMaranello
Reviews.Content: Please don't consider another hotel if you value a condo sized room with incredible views of the bay. Forget check in. A breeze. No lobby, no restaurant, no bar and no real health club. No matter. The rooms are a work of art. Spacious, tastefully furnished, and perfect in every respect. This property gives new meaning to the term suite. The beds are wonderful, linens superb. The bathrooms, three in our two bedroom unit, are perfectly adequate. Park Hyatt Chicago luxury? No, but damn close. No tub and only one sink but not an issue. Large walk in showers are a pleasure. Use the spacious bathroom upstairs or the half bath downstairs. A fully equipped kitchen with a wine cooler and all top of the line appliances is adjacent to a beautiful dining room and living area with a gas fireplace. A flat green tv along with a dvd player and stereo is standard. This place is just as home. Oh, I forgot the washer and dryer. Jeremy is the go to concierge. Joe is also an all star. The rest of the staff is eager and professional. A house car is available for drop off and pickup. The director, Mr. Sylvester, made everyone feel right at home. The continental breakfast is outstanding, with fresh fruit and yogurt, as well as a selection of pastries, eggs, and beverages. Bottom line- don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Intro to the USA”
Reviews.Author: Sanrod
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a 6 week tour of the States and it was a great introduction. We stayed from 27th September through till 2nd October and loved every minute of it. There were two couples and we had a 2 bed/2bathroom suite overlooking the square. The facilities were excellent and it is so close to everything, particularly Fishermen's Wharf. On the second day of our holiday I suffered a dose of food poisoning and the staff were extremely helpful in arranging medical assistance for me and then continually checked on my progress through the following day to ensure that I was OK - all above and beyond the call of duty. Whilst I lost one day of our San Fran holiday the rest of our time was excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes that little bit of extra luxury in a hotel. Thanks to all the staff at Fairmont Ghiradelli.

Reviews.Title: “My best family holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derek0308
Reviews.Content: I take family holidays at least once a year for the last 15 years and this is the best holiday hotel I have stayed. There were too many things we enjoyed in our stay. - right after I booked my stay on the Internet, I received a welcome email from the hotel, introducing and telling me the facilities I could use during my stay. On this same trip, I was going to stay in two other "top" hotels in LA and LV But none other offered such service. - on arrival, we (family of 4) were greeted warmly and our first surprise was we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment for free, normally in US an upgrade is offered at a discount. - the room was simply stunning. Even though we didn't get the Bay View room, the interior of the room was really nice and clean. The fire pit was a nice feature too. - while the design is classical, the features are absolutely state of the art. The lightings are with dimmer, the fantastic TV and hi-fi system produced great sound, plus wine cellar and laundry are nice touch too. - we stayed for 4 nights and our greatest day was spent on the bicycle from the hotel. The bike rental was complimentary, and they even provided helmet, lock, and back pack with water bottle in it for all 4 of us! Great attention to details! - the house car was another great feature. The pickup was always on time. - we absolutely loved the complimentary breakfast. Nice cosy setting with good quality food. - the pool table, board games, and the large DVD collections were nice features too, though my kids were disappointed that we could not get our waitlisted DVD, "Escape from Alcatraz" after waited for 4 nights as the hotel has the policy of not asking back from the guest once it is out - the service from the duty manager to the concierge were very friendly and attentive. I want to take this opportunity to thank the duty managers, Spencer and Jeremy. You really made our stay memorable. We just checked out this morning and we already miss you! In fact we are now just in our 2nd stop at Venetian in LV before going to LA, but we knew we have had our best stay already! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot talk this hotel up enough.....”
Reviews.Author: Poults10
Reviews.Content: As soon as we entered we were greeted by the Concierge who gave us a personal tour of the hotel and our room. We were immediately upgraded from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom apartment which included a full kitchen, lounge room and two bathrooms. This hotel is located close to most attractions and is right near the wharfs here all the action happens. It also has a car service which will take you within a 2 km radius - first com first served. Ghirardelli Square has great restaurants, shops and a winery tasting cellar. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, some service issues”
Reviews.Author: SheaG
Reviews.Content: I travel to SF once or twice a year, often with some or all of my (mostly adult) children. I have had trouble finding the perfect hotel. Although I've found some properties I've liked, most of the rooms have been too small. Problem solved with the fantastic residences at the Fairmont Ghirardelli Square. We reserved a 2 bedroom residence over Thanksgiving week for 7 nights for us and our four children, as they advertised they could accommodate six, with a queen size sofa bed in the living room. Prior to our arrival, I exchanged several emails with the concierge staff, who arranged several dinner and brunch reservations. Upon arrival, we were greeted pleasantly and efficiently and shown briefly around the property before being shown to our room. The first impression is most impressive. The furnishings and colors are understated but elegant. Exposed brick, wide plank wood floors, a spacious kitchen and bedrooms, and the lovely art work makes you feel as if you have your own luxury apartment in the city. There is a bathroom in each bedroom, plus a half bath in the hallway. Only the 'master' bedroom had a tub, however. The beds in the bedrooms are large with excellent linens and mattresses. The sofa bed, however, was very uncomfortable. The kitchen and dining area was spacious. Cookware and dinnerware is adequate, but not generous. The pullout fridge and freezer are quite small. The wine cooler is a big bonus. The location is great, but one of the huge perks is the hotel cars which are new Escalades that will take you within a 2 mile radius and often more. Much better than a taxi! We utilized this service often. Drivers were friendly and very confident. The very nice BMW bicycles are a big perk although one day the brakes on one of our bikes were junk. The terrace overlooking the square with fire pits and heaters was very nice, as was the complimentary wine service from 4-5pm, but the property really needs a full service, full time bar. Complimentary Breakfast was simple continental with stale pastries, but the fruit, tea, and coffee were good. Room service is available with delivery from a few local restaurants but the delivery charge is hefty. The flat screen TVs are great, excellent lighting and central air and heat. Free reliable wireless is awesome. The only thing that really marred the excellent experience were some service issues. Service was generally great, but there were some glitches. The bathroom light was out in our room on arrival, and it took three days and four requests to fix it. I spilled wine on our bed sheets one night and the next night after the room had been serviced, I got in bed and saw the sheets had not been changed, as the wine stain was still there. It made me wonder if they had changed sheets on previous nights. There were also never enough towels. Most of the concierges were really great, but we had a couple of negative experiences with what may have been the same concierge, a female, who gave me wrong directions as I was waiting downtown for a house car pickup, and also when we requested a tailor, basically told us it couldn't be done. We asked another concierge who had a tailor for us in minutes. My adult sons working out in the fitness room got treated rudely by a staff member who challenged whether they were staying on property and called security apparently to verify, thus creating a little scene which was unnecessary. None of these little problems were sufficient to turn me off the place though, as it is a gorgeous property and good value for what you get. I would, however, for more than four people, get the three bedroom. The sofa bed just isn't comfortable and with only one tub and two showers, it doesn't work well for more than four. we'll definitely be back, especially as they're planning on adding a spa next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: JimiMcV
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated as treasured guests. The suite was huge (we booked a one bedroom and were upgraded to a two bedroom) with gorgeous amenities, comfortable furnishings and a spectacular view. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. You really couldn't want much more in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At!!!”
Reviews.Author: Atltraveler607
Reviews.Content: This a belated review, but we took a Family Trip to San Francisco in April/May 2011. This was our second hotel of the trip, and as I spend 50+ hotels nights yearly, I can easily say this is the greatest Hotel I've ever stayed in. We had 2 teenage boys with us, and they loved it too. They loved having their own room, the breakfast fed their appetite daily as it provided fresh fruits, breads, yogurt and more. Coffee was fantastic! We loved having the kitchen as we brought in take out one night and ate at "home" like the hotel was home. Staff was amazing, friendly, and professional. We loved the courtesy car as this made the trip for us. We actually left a bag at the hotel, and shipped it back cross country without complaint (we provided shipping payment). I hope the boys don't grow up to fast so we can bring them back!!!

Reviews.Title: “san fran in style”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKerrie
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic we had excellent service ,breakfasts also we got a free upgrade complete with washing machine bath tub walk in walk out shower comfortable clean and quiet We tossed up wether to stay at fishermans wharf or Union square and we were glad we stayed here as the only thing in Union square is shops At least by the water there is more to do and see.We caught the trolley car up to union square.highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: denham_10
Reviews.Content: Great views, very central and wonderful rooms. Full kitchens. Complimentary newspaper and buffet breakfast. Hard to beat in SF

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: I have loved this hotel for years but I think my recent stay will be my last. Terrible room service, indifferent staff, tired facilities, dreadful health club. If you are a Fairmont President's Club member, don't expect any extras here. No Gold Lounge, upgrades range from spectacular to disgusting at the discretion of rude desk staff. They seem more focused on selling condos than serving guests.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Geej
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. My husband and I took our two boys (9 &14) for a long Halloween weekend trip and got a 2 bedroom city view. It was HUGE! There are 2 masters -- each with own bath - ours was a bit more posh -- but you could definitely have 2 couples share a 2 bedroom. The kitchen and living room are very large and brand new -- you feel like you are in a NYC loft apartment. (I was hoping they would upgrade us to a "Bay View" and I asked several times -- but it was fine having CIty view since we rarely looked out the windows.) This hotel suite was so light and airy you didn't feel the need to have the shades up. The hotel is in a great location -- close enough to walk to Fisherman's Wharf and all the sights but tucked away at Giaradelli Square which is much more mellow. There are restaurants all around and a great Cupcake Store and Candy Shop right outside. Also, a Starbucks and the Buena Vista Restaurant is 2 blocks away (where the first Irish Coffee was "invented" or brought to the States -- advice-- go for the Irish Coffee - but DO NOT eat a meal there -- not very good!). The water is literally 2 blocks away or less. And there are 2-3 bike rental stores also right around the corner. This is a Fabulous place to stay with kids and the Wharf area has great things for kids to do. But you can still get around to other parts of the city and there is a Cable Car stop one block away as well. Breakfast is included -- They have a lovely comfy breakfast room (with upholstered chairs) and also a great outdoor patio with coal fire pit, which we sat by every morning (in light jackets) and ate our breakfast -- alone -- it was as if we owned a huge house in downtown San Fran. The Breakfast is really nice -- coffee, fresh juices, 3 kinds of cereal, very nice fresh fruit, an assortment of bagels and muffins. (Might have been some boiled eggs.) We ate there all 4 mornings and were quite satisfied with it. One of our best experiences was that they have a "House Car" which we used every day and it was always available when we needed it. The first day we were driven to the Alcatraz Ferry and our driver (I wish I could remember his name he was so nice) decided to give our boys a thrill so he drove us down a few winding, bumpy streets, including Lombard (most crooked street)!! He did this even though it was a bit out of the way to our destination but we had time and just loved the adventure! That that started our morning off with a bang and the boys were thrilled. It saved my husband and I having to walk them down it the next day! The hotel also gives a Wall Street Journal or New York Times each morning and the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. Each driver we had was friendly and personable and really made the trip! I can't say ENOUGH great things about this hotel! Worth EVERY penny -- splurge and get the Bay Viewl egs we were there and just ate a larger lunch each dayre3 mo( and and it felt like we owned theend eely patio with outBreakl th Bay openas a pobt THe weather was great 0ea late October -- (Last d

Reviews.Title: “i like the design”
Reviews.Author: kamkhang
Reviews.Content: i went with my family heritage i really like which they design there apartment,, i must say designer work very hard for given the lovely look,, lobby is also good i mean lobby area is also big,, food is really follow 5* standard. i highly recommended this hotel for people

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place for a special occasional get away”
Reviews.Author: RosanneF-B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Heritage Place for our 25th Anniversary. We had a beautiful two bedroom apartment. The kitchen was outfitted with the best appliances - Wolf stove, Subzero wine cooler, etc. I wished we could have stayed long enough to cook some of the wonderful produce we found at the Farmer's Market. I think one of the best things about the room was the quality linens from the comfortable bed to the feather pillows, down duvet, cool crisp sheets and fluffy towels. The continental breakfast was a good mix of fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, bread, hard boiled eggs and pastry. We also enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese that was served everyday between 4 and 5 p.m. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back some day.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Abigaild88
Reviews.Content: warm welcoming, great service, beautiful, clean, designed, spacious, well eqipped suites. located near the peirs. nothing less than the best

Reviews.Title: “What a stunning brilliant place.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgencyManager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such a wonderful time here. The apartment was a 2 bedroom place. Beautiful design and the softest linen. Loved the original bare brick walls. The service is the thing that really makes the Fairmont Ghirardelli though. From check in, to porters and doormen this place excels. The complimentary BMW bikes are a great touch, but most fantastic is the free 4x4 chevy to drop off and pick up within 2 miles. Thanks to Santiago for picking us up at various bars! You were polite, professional and so helpful, a great asset to the Fairmont! Shall recommend to EVERYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Fleet Week (or any week..)”
Reviews.Author: DMH8400
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Fleet Week in October 2011. This is an incredible location to view the air show because the Blue Angels and the Canadian Snow Birds come right over (literally) the Ghirardelli sign to start their shows. Perfect hotel, perfect weather, wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: mark o
Reviews.Content: Just finished an 8 night stay as a family of 5. Could not have stayed anywhere better. Location is wonderful. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Very family friendly. Quiet. Recommend this place without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the staff....”
Reviews.Author: Sixela35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for 3 nights and wished we would have booked more time. The suites are extremely well appointed and the location is so convenient to many "must-sees". We had a one bedroom suite overlooking the square. We experienced no noise and kept the shades lowered during early AM and when lights were on at night. This did not detract in the least from the ambience. The staff really helped to make our stay thoroughly enjoyable. The concierge, Jeremy, extended his wonderful recommendations for dining even into our next stay in Napa! He was also very helpful pre-visit with our rental car needs and once there, suggesting walks and sites to visit within the city. Peter was extremely helpful in explaining the property and the local surroundings. Our suite was spotless each morning and evening thanks to housekeeping! On a sunny afternoon, the vistas from the upper fire pit area were marvelous! We took a complimentary glass of wine, plate of cheese, and enjoyed watching the boats in the bay. When we return to SF, this will be our choice of accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: micksals
Reviews.Content: Lets get the bad points out of the way first - we only stayed for four nights and we are not still there. Now for the good: Brilliant location a short walk to Fishermans Wharf, but far enough away for relaxation. Massive rooms full of quality fixtures and fittings. Very comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Bay view option (absolute must) with clear views of Alcatraz and everything happening in the bay. Complimentary breakfast, with fresh fruit, breads, pastries, cereals etc all regularly topped up. Complimentary DVD library (100's) with films delivered to your door in 5 minutes. Complimentary bicycles (2 x Adult and 2 x Kids) perfect for biking Golden Gate. The bike track is directly in front of the hotel. Complimentary house car ( 7 seater quality vehicle) for trips within 2 miles which covers just about everywhere you would want to visit on a short trip including Union Square. Complimentary wine and cheese reception every day, with great wine as you might expect for this area. Superb staff, every last one of them, smiles everywhere, genuinely made to feel that they all wanted us to have a great time and we did. I almost feel guilty to single one member of staff out for a specific mention, but Henry the concierge was fantastic. If I knew the names of the maids that serviced our room they would all be mentioned also - without doubt the best maid service of any property I have ever stayed in, spotless and once again smiles everywhere. As the title says, this place is perfect, it somehow manages to have quality and class without being stuffy. If you find a better hotel than this in San Francisco please tell me about it.

Reviews.Title: “The girls squealed with delight..”
Reviews.Author: Winegirl1950
Reviews.Content: Wine Country and San Francisco trip with our young adult daughter and niece, needed to book two rooms so we decided to rent apartments instead. We were greeted warmly and given a first class check in experience by the very cordial concierge. Complimentary wine/cheese in the pm, complimentary extended continental breakfast in the am. The girls literally squealed when we walked into the 2BR/2BA unit: a sexy, spacious, sophisticated city apartment with almost everything you could want. Plenty of room for us all. Only complaint is the units are perhaps 5 years old and could use some deep cleaning. Furniture, cabinets, woodwork a little beaten up. Fancy, expensive AV system but remotes not programmed properly so the equipment didn't work, and the staff couldn't make it work. Microwave/convection oven near the floor, very inconvenient to use--should be at eye level. Room lighting was insufficient for reading, as in most hotels--bring your own lightbulbs or go blind. They had an SUV to squire you around town on a first come first serve basis, very convenient! Some of the best, most sincere, most thorough service we've ever had in any hotel anywhere. This place was pricey but I think worth it.

Reviews.Title: “OMG this place is the place to stay..!”
Reviews.Author: tubby75
Reviews.Content: Where do i start with this review. We arrived rather late after a flight from Orlando. Was freezing cold but was greeted but the lovely staff at the hotel. I felt rather overwhelmed if i'm honest as we were in shorts etc and others in the lobby were dressed up for the evening. Felt as if i shouldn't be staying somewhere so beautiful. This didn't matter as the check in was amazing very personnel and everything explained. We had a one bedroom apartment with a sofa bed in the lounge for the children. We had a balcony overlooking Ghirardelli square, others have mentioned noise but we found it very quiet. The loft style apartment was very modern just to my liking, the kitchen had everything you could think of wine cooler, fridge etc washer and dryer. My only gripe was the shower, but then i have found that water pressure is very different in the usa to the uk, in that there is non. They had even left chocolates for us as a welcome gift. A member of staff (can't remember her name) showed us to our room and explained how everything worked, a godsend for all the gadgets. We had to nip out for some milk almost as soon as we arrived for our kids, there is a little store over the road that we went to. As we were in there two homeless people came in but to our amazement the door man from the hotel was in there waiting for us to escort us back to the hotel. Made us feel very cared for as silly as that sounds. They have a 700 dvd library where you ring down what you would like to watch and they deliver it to the room. Excellent touch, we tend not to venture to far in the evenings with the kids as we were all tired from sightseeing. We had a major problem when we arrived in the chaos of things i forgot to book a trip to alcatraz or anythings else. The receptionist (again can't remember her name) explained that alcatraz was booked all week i was crest fallen.. all that way and we were going to miss the one thing i wanted to see. After the excitement of arriving, the room etc i was so down i was nearly in tears. She said to leave it with her and she would see what she could do. After a sick feeling all night next morning i slump to reception to find her ringing round trying everything she could to help us. To my delight she sorted us a two day bus loop tour, alcatraz island trip and a bike ride over the bridge to saulsilito. Still to this day i can't thank her enough, we had the best time ever..! The hotel offers a continental breakfast which is lovely you can even grab some bits and have it in your room. By the end of our stay the waiter bought out croissants for our youngest as soon as he see her :) We didn't venture to the roof terrace until the day we left, it was a glorious sunny day and we could see alcatraz and all the hustle and bustle of ghirardelli square. We never used the house car during our stay as we love walking plus was sightseeing all through the day. All the staff here are wonderful remember your name, are friendly and go out of there way to help with whatever you may need. Every night we had a turn down service and the maid got ready the bed for the children. I didn't really want to write this review as i kinda want to keep this hotel secret as it was so amazing. I would return to San Francisco in a heartbeat it's the best city i have ever visited (although the weather did get me down abit) and i would 100% stay here again, yes it's more expensive than other hotels but believe me it's the little things that make it amazing. Another tip we used Blazing Saddles tour company for our sightseeing trips, they were brilliant to, we had to pass there office everyday to get back to the hotel. Everytime the two guys working in there asked weather we had a good day, what we had been up to etc. Spoke to the kids about the bike ride was really nice and personnel that they remembered us each time. After a 22 mile bike ride we did get why they were called 'Blazing Saddles'... Day after the bike ride we had a 12 hour flight home sitting on another seat took me a week for my rear end to feel normal :D Amazing hotel, Amazing staff.. Book it..!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Planning our return.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in a great location. The room was spacious, meticulously clean, and well appointed. The hotel staff provided great friendly service that exceeded my expectations. We were particularly appreciative of their restaurant recommendations. Some of the hotel/room highlights included wolf appliances, rack audio system, quality bedding, and a sub zero wine fridge. The breakfast was a perfect start to our day and the car service made our dinners out special. The room mirrored all of the professional photos provided by the Fairmont and I was not disappointed. Jean, thank you to you and your team for making the start of our honeymoon perfect - we hated to leave and cannot wait to return. I truly enjoyed our conversations and your Maui restaurant recommendations were spot-on. Christie and I look forward to seeing you again soon. In the end there is no doubt as to why your hotel is #1.

Reviews.Title: “This truly deserves No 1.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb2410
Reviews.Content: After using trip advisor for our honeymoon we had our 1st bad experience of a good bad review, and checked into no 3 at the time Inn at the Square. This was a very bad experience and a bit of a throw back to the 70's after 30 minutes I decided to go have a look at what else was available. I luckily found the Fairmont on Nobhill and for $150 got an amazing room with a view of the bridge and alcatraz. We were only staying in the bay for a night as it was our honeymoon and planned a big tour of america over 5 weeks. I was lucky enough to see an advert for Ghirardelli Square and booked that for our last two nights prior to departure. It was truly the send off we needed after a fantastic tour fo the states, driving from San Fran to Portland, to Missoula montana to yellowstone, jackson wyoming, then to vegas, death valley, yosemite, santa barbara and then back to san fran. The highlights for context were. No 1. Four Seasons Santa Barbara.(hard to beat watching hummbirds whilst drinking a coktail and watching the waves come crashing in from the Pacific.) No 2 Fairmont Ghiradelli Square for the unbelievable room. No 3 Spotted horse Ranch, Jackson. No 4 Paws Up Ranch , Montana.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jessamies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the finest. Great service, rooms, breakfast and views. We stayed for four nights and would go back again and again, cannot recommend highly enough! Only down side, the chauffeur driven car is usually over subscribed so not usually available when you need it and unfortunately when we were there the bikes were not available as they were being fixed. Overall though would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Donna D
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything. Location, quality service and wonderful accomodations. I am not a high maintenance traveler but I do appreciate and recognize a great experience. This is an upscale hotel with upscale service and amenities. The hotel is very urban chic with a well appointed but unconventional registration area. The staff sit behind desks not your typical long check-in counters. They give you a quick tour of the facilities that include a nice lounge, business center and terrace with a view of the bay. Continental breakfast is served every morning and wine and cheese in the evening. Both are excellent and everything is very fresh. They provide umbrellas when it is raining, a towncar that will drop you off and pick you up within a 2-5? mile radius of the hotel and bicycles if you want to do some cycling. The firepit and terrace are a real plus and just spectacular on a clear day. You can watch everything going on in the bay. We were there for Fleet Week and we had the best seat in the house on this terrace. The rooms are very spacious and efficient. You have all the necessary utencils, plates, cookware, glasses and appliances to cook a meal. There is a microwave and a wine cooler. We had a 2 bedroom with a pullout couch. It also had a half bath which was very useful. We had 5 adults and all were comfortable. The housekeeping was spotless. This was the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. There are many places to shop and eat in the area as it is Fisherman's Wharf. We walked everywhere and having The Buena Vista a block away was a great place to end the day with an Irish coffee. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best there is !!!”
Reviews.Author: accurateanswer
Reviews.Content: Having just had the pleasure of staying at the Fairmont for 4 nights .. for the second time , I cans tell you that there is no better.. anywhere in the great city of San Francisco - I know personally having stayed at all the "upscale " hotels for the past 15 years .. Jean-Francois and his crew are the best at what they do .. make you feel like family when you stay with them .. great room - view of the bay -- .. service -- town car .. etc...Go ahead pamper yourself .. stay at this hotel.. you wont be disappointed !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy being "home" in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Tallereid
Reviews.Content: Location: Ghiradelli Square, close to Fisherman Warf. About 35 minutes from airport with taxi, cost appr. 50 usd. Walking distance to chinatown is 30 minutes. You can take Muni (buses) to fx Height Ashbury close to the Fairmont, 2 usd pr person, 3 hour use. Rooms: This is an appartmnet hotell consisting of different types, studio, 2,3,4 bedroom and various location within the buliding. Some with terraces. We stayed three nights in a 2 bedroom with bay view and a direct access to common terrace area, 2nd floor and four nights in a 2 bedroom city view, 2nd floor. Two very different feelings, the bay view is light and spacious in the living area, but both bedrooms face the city. People are able to see you when you are in, without taking blinds down of course and all the others need to pass your appartment on the way to theirs and since it is free use for all, it is less privacy and more noisy outside. But very nice view even on second floor. City view have all the windows facing the street. It is a bit darker but cosier and we personally think this was a better. Floorplan was fine, fx you will not hear the washing machine going when sitting in the livingroom, which happens in the bayview appartment. And much more private, wich suited us better. Since we were two persons it is obviously more than enough space. We loved the ambience, the very luxurious ameneties, like all you need the kitchen, bathrobes, towels and amazing beds!! Maybe some of the best we ever have been sleeping in. Windows facing street are double, no disturbance during the night. Service: Generally good service. Only one of 7 days, housekeepng was late. Small thing, like a box of delicious chocolate welcomed us back. Nice. (We spend one night in LA before returning to SF) House car, Cadillac Escelade will take you where ever you want within a range of 2 miles. Younger peolpe working there, wich we found great! We also took advantage of the two bicycle they have, reservation is necessary. A lot of dvds fto choose from, brought to your door with popcorn.. Some problems with the internet the last couple of days, but we used the business center and the wi fi did work in the reception area. Conclusion: If you are a family , a group of friends this is a very good place to stay. Then the real value kicks in. It is a little steep for a couple. But we had a fantastic stay, and actually made dinner â€�homeâ€� every night and the local shop on the other side of the place have a 6 usd chardonney we highly recommendâ€¦Also, Whole Foods are the best place for groceries. Hopefully we will be able to return to SF and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: MadClem
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and can only agree with other reviewers that this is an excellent example of how a hotel should be. The area does not have many good restaurants but it is easy to get around so this was not a great problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: shabbasimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel at the end of Aug 2011 and it really does live up to the hype - we were very impressed especially by the exceptionally high level of service all the staff give. We were travelling to celebrate a wedding anniversary and on arrival at the hotel we were surprised by a room upgrade to a bay view with a large outside terrace with stunning views of Alcatraz and a bottle of champagne with chocolate dipped strawberries . We were travelling with our 3 year old son - whom the staff made such a wonderful fuss of - so the early start time of the breakfast (lots of fresh produce) was very helpful as was the unexpected proximity to a little sandy beach.The convenience of having a washing machine & tumble dryer was great too. We made daily use of the town car which always appeared to be available when we asked and the concierge staff both pre arrival & once at the hotel went out of their way to find out information to help us make the most of our visit. My only rather minor negative would be that I had expected to have had a bath rather than just a shower in our room as this would have been more useful for our son - the shower cubicle was huge so there would have been plenty of space to accomodate a bath tub too. Would definately choose this hotel and their brand again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNJ201
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to stay here with the Bay view, you have to do it. perfect location and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: FTMNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had 3 couples in a 3 bedroom suite. The rooms are amazing. The staff is so helpful and friendly. The hotel car will take you anywhere you want to go within a 2 mi radius. Mustards terrace has a view to die for overlooking the bay. We had an unforgettable trip. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jnahoum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for 4 nights and it was absolutely wonderful. One of the best hotels we have ever visited. Everything was lovely, elegant, upscale. Bedding luxurious, kitchen completely furnished with beautiful pieces. Having the entire family together in the same "residence" was wonderful. They even gave us a list of all of the dvd movies in the free library.Staff was unbelievably nice and helpful, over phone and in person. Went out of their way to satisfy. Loved the wine and cheese around the fire on the patio. We spent the first part of each evening here before going out on town. They also helped us find a rental mini van that we were told was impossible to getfor our trip to Napa. Can't wait to go back and have already recommended them to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with little kids”
Reviews.Author: suitestayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas on our first trip to San Francisco. Loved it! We had a 2 bedroom residence that we Booked through sanfranciscoluxuryhotels.com. It was huge, super clean and very modern. The kitchen was a big plus and so were the fireplaces. It was just like having your own really cool apartment in San Francisco. The location was great too. The wharf area is great for kids and I never found it a problem to get from there to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: chuck h
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my sister while visiting for a conference. It is simply the nicest hotel I have been in, ever! Everything was superb! There was nothing lacking at all with regards to the service and accommodation. If I could afford it, I would stay here for a month.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodSister
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nearly a week at the Fairmont and would highly recommend it! We arrived early in the day, but they graciously stored our luggage while we did some sightseeing. Later, Peter, the staff person in charge of the wine room, graciously served us wine on the terrace while we waited for our room to become available! All of the staff members were very congenial, and the concierge staff was particularly helpful. We found the complimentary house car to be very helpful (within a 2 mile radius), and the drivers generally very friendly. The 2-bedroom residence we stayed in couldn't have been more beautiful or convenient. The terrace, firepit, and gazebo were just steps outside our door along with daily serenades from the musicians below in Ghirardelli Square. The view of the bay was spectacular from our room, and we often used the table and chairs just outside our door to read the complimentary newspaper that was delivered daily. A delicious breakfast with lots of fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc. was also complimentary, as well as a wine and cheese happy hour and games/puzzles! The beds and pillows were very comfortable, the kitchen well-stocked with daily necessities, and there were three large flat screen TV's. Unfortunately we couldn't figure out how to use the bedroom TV's except with DVD's - we discovered on the last day that the controls were concealed in a nightstand panel - who knew!?. The bathrooms were lovely, though a solid door separating them from the bedrooms would be more conducive to sleep for anyone remaining in bed while the bathroom was in use (the doors had frosted glass panels). The frosted panels would be more useful on the shower doors for a bit of privacy when someone else came through to use the separate water closet. There was also some street noise from pedestrians on the street-side of the hotel. Overall, the bay view, terraces, location, amenities and staff made it the perfect place to stay in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to chill”
Reviews.Author: DWGermany
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Heritage is a beautifull and quiet place in the middle of San Francisco to chill out and see the city. The view to the bay and alcatraz is simply amazing. The hotel has two very nice terasses to relax. Unfortunatly they do not serve anything on those terasses. The rooms are really well equiped and clean. The fitness room is ok, not to many options. The service is really good, the complemenatry limosine was very helpfull to get where you wanted to be. Wifi access was free and good. We had a sweet with bay view and it had a nice living room with a complete kitchen and a fireplace. The food and beverage offerings are limited due to the setup of the place but you can walk to plenty of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location - best hotel in SF!”
Reviews.Author: ks_bazhenova
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great - I do confirm that it's the number 1 hotel in SF! We were traveling together with my husband - exploring the city of SF. The rooms are huge - we got a 2 bedroom apartment with spacious kitchen + dining area, 2 bathrooms (1 with a bath, 1 with shower), cool media system with big TV (+another 2 TVs in the bedrooms). The rooms were very clean and very well maintained. But the best thing about this hotel is service - concierge service is very good; there is a Cadillac Escalade to take guests to the places around the city and pick them up to take back to the hotel - this is a complimentary service available for all guests. Whatever we needed - there was always someone to help us immediately. Breakfast is also good, although there is not much to choose from, but the quality of food is good (a lot of fresh fruits and berries). Location is very good - a lot of great restaurants around Ghirardelli Square, easy to explore the city, close to piers. I definitely confirm that this is the best hotel in SF. - After our stay we flu to Hawaii and when came back and stayed 2 nights in Omni hotel (rated Best Luxury hotel in SF in TripAdvisor), which we did not like at all compared to Fairmont, although the price was nearly the same or even more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SusC1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location was worth paying the extra to get room with a view over the Bay. Two bed apartment was spacious and to a very high standard. Beds were so comfy. Friendly and efficient service from all the staff. Only downside was a very small breakfast area. Nice touch was the free wine and cheese twisting daily at 5pm. Would love to stay here again and would deffinately recommend Heritage Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel numerous times for business over the course of the past year and I love staying here. The rooms are very nice and the staff is incredibly accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GoinDownToCali
Reviews.Content: I planned a huge weekend in San Francisco so that I could propose to my girlfriend. I chose Frisco because that is where we fell in love. Anyway, to the point about this hotel. This place is absolutely gorgeous! Not only that, but the staff is impeccable. If there were more than 5 stars, I would give it more. From the doorman to front desk to housekeeping, everyone went way above and beyond. My only regret is that I did not propose here as I am sure the staff would have made it amazing. I travel a lot for work, usually to the east coast, so I am very picky about where I stay. My suggestion is that you definitely stay here if you are ever in the area, even if it is only for one night. You will not regret it. Oh, she said yes, and we will be returning for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful rooms & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BournePlace
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July 2011. Having booked a one bed bay view appartment, we were fortunate to be upgraded to a two bed bay view. The whole experience of our stay here was just fantastic. The appartment are superbly set up with everything we needed & more for a San Francisco base. We found all the staff very helpful, we made good use of the complimentary Concierge Car. The sanctuary of the Terrace to spend time with a book & glass of wine just above the bustling tourist hub that Ghirardelli Square has become, was one of the great memories of our stay. Fantastic views in a luxurious setting....just perfect....Would absolutely recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: WRCF
Reviews.Content: Although fishermans wharf touristy the ghirardelli feels apart and offers great accommodation great service and a really delicious breakfast. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: michelle0404
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and cannot fault at all - everything has been thought of and the service is superb. I love the location on Ghiradelli Square with a great view out across Bay and Alcatraz. The hotel provides everything you want. There are quite a few restaurants around but the hotel has a house car which will drop you off at other locations close by.

Reviews.Title: “Why cant there be more hotels like this one”
Reviews.Author: AnAussieAbroad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 2 children (16 and 12) stayed in this hotel on our recent holiday for 4 nights. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and were knocked out at the size of the suite and the very high level of decoration and facilities. The location is excellent and Ghirardelli square and wonderful site. The staff is very accommodating both before you arrive and during your stay. They had contacted us before our arrival and arranged for groceries to be purchased which were waiting onn or arrival. The The hotel is hip but friendly and the rooms quiet while being in a location that had energy. Restaurants are handy, and if you need to go further afield the house car if its available will take you. We are a fairly well travelled family having stayed in many hotels, and are also very fussy, and this hotel is inour collective view the best we have ever stayed in for its unique blend of features, and great service, and the capacity to enjoy some independence while having hotel facilities. If however your preference is for the large hotel environment this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot for Families”
Reviews.Author: HotlantaAlpharetta
Reviews.Content: My Wife and two children (9 & 11) stayed a full week over the July 4th weekend in a 2-bedroom suite w/City View. Before we even arrived, Sarah and team at front desk contacted us via email to answer questions we had, helped us w/rental car reservations, and gave us recommendations to restaurants. Once we arrived, Sarah gave us a tour of the facilities, the multiple terraces, etc. to acquaint us with hotel. Our 2-bedroom suite was spacious. Great kitchen setup, fully furnished. Traveling w/kids, it was really convenient having a washer/dryer in the room. Location was fabulous (2 blocks from Hyde Street Cable Cars). Being on the Bay but slightly down from the Wharf, it was convenient if you're interested in biking along the bay or to GG Bridge, going out for a run in the morning, or just having plenty of restaurants or shops (cupcakes, desserts, etc., which our kids frequented daily) to satisfy almost anyone traveling. I initially thought being so close near the Wharf that it would be too noisy or close to all the tourists, but the location is far enough where it never became an issue. The best amenity was the House Car. We practically used it daily, and over a full week, including the July 4th weekend when the hotel was completely booked, it was only unavailable once to us when we needed it. If you plan on staying here, I think you can absolutely go without a rental car (unless you plan on going outside the city like we did for a day). We also used the house bikes (BMWs!) - should definitely take advantage of this if they are available (one note of caution - the kids bikes are small and they did not fit our 9 & 11 yr-olds, so we ended up renting for them). Great breakfast daily (fresh fruit, bagles, etc.) and my wife and I did the wine/cheese one afternoon. Had previously read on Tripadvisor where city view rooms were noisy,. Although we heard an occasional bus/cars, it was never that bad...just keep in mind you are staying in the city! The only negative I could come up with was the small closet space. Could use a bit more room/space...other than that, would have to say this was an excellent facility and definitely one everyone should experience! My understanding is this won't be a hotel forever...once they sell all their fractional units, it will go private. So enjoy while you can!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Ghiradelli Square Huge Rooms and Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanRedTag
Reviews.Content: Extremely delightful staff, complimentary Cadillac Escalade hotel transportation around hotel, amazing views of the Bay and Alcatraz, huge 2-bedroom, 2 1/2 bath, fully equipped kitchen, living, apartment-sized stacked washer & dryer, complimentary can of coffee, all in the heart of Ghiradelli Square. We stayed during President's Day weekend and had the cable cars, shops and piers within walking distance. We did utilize the complimentary Escalade to a recommended nearby brunch cafe. The location is ideal to the stated areas, the hotel staff rated 5 stars for customer service and our room was much larger than I expected. Complimentary continental breakfast is included for all guests. It's enough to get your energy before the daily tourist activities.

Reviews.Title: “Like Feris Buller said, "if you have the means, I highly recommend it."”
Reviews.Author: elgallagher
Reviews.Content: Really could not be better. A two bedroom condo in Ghiradelli square, with great views, an outdoor fireplace etc etc..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property with a Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: mansilovesshoes
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our trip to San Francisco and our stay at the Fairmont Heritage Place, Ghirardelli Square as a stop over on the way back from our honeymoon. The service and hotel experience was out of this world. We cooked dinner, watched a movie, went to the roof top for a drink, enjoyed the wine and cheese and light breakfast in the lounge and finally a ride in the hotel car. It is the perfect location and hotel to just unwind and relax in San Fran either with your significant other or the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “I only stay here in SF”
Reviews.Author: wendytruth
Reviews.Content: This is truly my home away from home. The apartments (they are not rooms) are spacious, well appointed and sumptous. THe only problem is that everyone else has discovered this place. The views from the bay side rooms are incredible. You see the Golden Gate bridge as well as Alcatraz. The only drawback is that there is no room service. There is no restaurant attached to the hotel. THey offer a generous complimentary breakfast and wine at 5 o'clock but if you get hungry after dinner you are out of luck. Isn't a great place for small children either and the gym is still years away.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: NyRudie
Reviews.Content: From the friendly, relaxed greeting to the beautiful but totally unpretentious way the Fairmont Heritage conducts itself, I give this hotel a big ole' thumbs up. We were pleasantly greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to celebrate our 38th anniversary on our arrival. Sarah & Spencer, the concierges, were down to earth and so pleasant. The use of the hotel car was a nice perk as well as the practical washer/dryers. You just cannot beat the location, which is close to all local attractions. We enjoyed visiting, Alcatraz, seeing the GG Bridge, the Coit Museum, Muir Woods and having lunch with the Sea Lions on Pier 39. We just had an absolute ball. Carl Sandburg is correct. The worst thing about SF is leaving it. I felt the same about the Fairmont Heritage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AF270769
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the Fairmont Heritage and was suitably impressed. Wonderful location, close to Pier 39 and Alcatraz Landing. The hotel has a car service that can take you the short trip into Union Square for shopping, eating etc. This was very handy indeed. The staff were all very professional, helpful and polite. We were very lucky in that we booked a 1br apt and to our surprise and glee upgraded to a to a 2br. Maginificent appartment with huge balcony looking out toward Alcatraz. Ghirardelli Square below added to the enjoyment of the facilites. Kitchen was also handy. If we ever get back to San Fran, this will be our Plan A.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb experience!”
Reviews.Author: UKAndy-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at The Fairmont with my wife, and have to say that is one of the best hotel experiences we have had anywhere in the world. The hotel is perfectly located near to the tourist area (5 mins) of Fishermans Wharf, and about 10-15 minutes cab ride from the centre/Union Square area of SF. We had debated whether to stay more central to the city but we were really pleased that we decided on this location instead. The hotel standards are extremely high throughout the building and the room was superb. We had a room on the 3rd floor and we were upgraded from a one bedroom room/suite to a two bedroom suite (I think due to availability). The room was perfect with a great kitchen and lounge area and great bedrooms - very plush, contemporary and extremely clean. The only issue we found was a little bit of road noise in the room given we were on a road side section. Although this was not a major problem, if guests could swing a bay side room then this would not be a problem at all. The complimentary breakfasts were excellent - coffees/teas, pastries, bagels, cereals, fruit etc 7am - 10am. Very laid back and leisurely to start off the day and they could be enjoyed on the terrace. The staff were all superb and extremely helpful from the desk staff to the concierge team - all very, very good. This hotel was simply excellent and whilst it might be a few dollars more than the next one, it is worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates a bit of quality, a great location, and likes the service and the staff to be there when you need them, but in the background.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY A RETURN TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Koele
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont staff was so efficient and accomodated our early check-in request; they even upgraded us to a 2BR residence with views of the Bay and City from the 1BR City view residence we initially booked. It's a great place if you are accustomed to a spacious layout; modern with a loft-like feel. Super clean, excellent surround sound throughout the entire residence, perfect sized kitchen and dining area. Nice bathrooms too. Location is centralized to Ferry Building by car. Generally, really a great escape from the Pier area, which is a dichotomy from Ghiradelli Square. Totally recommend this experience as we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Six Stars - Excellent Hotel, Fabulous stay in your own SF apartment on the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I begin? If you are reading this and trying to determine whether this hotel will be better than others you may be considering. Stop considering - it's not only better - it's the BEST. It's worth every penny.... and here's why: Our stay was flawless. Check-in is quick, staff was knowledgeable and we were quickly showed to our room, which is really a One-bedroom Apartment in the middle of Ghirardelli Square. The "room" had a fully equipped kitchen, small fridge/freezer, dining table that seats 8, integrated stereo throughout, large flat screen tvs, immense balcony overlooking the Square, ridiculously comfortable bed, large bathroom with a shower that fits 4! The hotel offers complimentary car service within 2 miles of the hotel. Great thing is that almost everything is within that perimeter. This was one of the best perks - the drivers were also so nice and happy to pick you up. Quick, easy and so convenient. It was like having a chauffeured car on call! And the rides were sweet - we're talking Escalades. There is a complimentary breakfast - with the usual breads, juices, coffees and cereals with some hot items as well. Everything I had was excellent and it was a great way to start the day. Coffee and Tea are also available all day. They do complimentary wine tasting every evening as well. We had rented bikes one day and stopped by the hotel on our way back from the bridge. As the doorman saw us pull up, he quickly rushed outside and ushered the bikes into the lobby himself saving us from having to do the arduous task of locking the bikes ourselves after a long ride :) I didn't have a single complaint during the entire stay. Each evening I felt as if I were returning to my own home. It was a great feeling to have on vacation. We really didn't want to leave at all! This would be an excellent choice for couple or families traveling together. TIP: Stop by the farmer's market at Fort Mason or the Ferry Building and stock your fridge with all the fresh goodness that SF has to offer. The butter is amazing here - it really is true: cows are happier in California!

Reviews.Title: “7 teenage girls”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: For my daughter's 18th birthday we decided to escape to San Francisco. The thought of 3 separate hotel rooms was not appealing. I came upon the Fairmont Heritage Place and immediately booked. A very good decision on my part. My peace of mind was due to the safe and secure feeling from the moment we walked into the lobby. There was no way anyone was going to get through unnoticed! That was really comforting especially with 7 teenage girls! The rooms were spacious, the beds, extra comfortable, the bathrooms were large, the kitchen was beautiful with top of the line appliances and so much room for all the snacks we brought up, the staff was super friendly and the location was top notch. The girls walked everywhere. Hyde Street cable car station was a block away, Alcatraz was an easy mile walk, the complimentary car service was a great bonus and the girls enjoyed the drivers because they were " friendly and cute", the included continental breakfast was convenient and perfect for their later morning starts and most importantly, the Ghiradelli ice cream bar was open until past midnight and was in the same building!! Oh, the girls also loved sitting outside on the Mustard Terrace with the amazing firepit and the gorgeous view of Alcatraz and the waterfront. The girls were so impressed with the hotel and couldn't stop gushing about how they enjoyed being spoiled and didn't ever want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jacquie920
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont Ghiradelli twice. Once with my parents and once with friends. We just live 30 miles south of San Francisco, so coming here is just a fun way to get out of the house for the weekend without really planning a big trip. We love that it is dog friendly. Our first weekend there, we attended a wine class nearby. The Fairmont was great - providing car service to the class was so handy. The rooms are perfect for two couples as we each had our own bedrooms and bathrooms. It is also nice to have a full kitchen, living room, and washer/dryer. You are able to really make yourself at home. The second weekend, we had a dinner party for 8. The Fairmont hooked us up with a personal chef. She worked with us in advance to create a menu that suited the omnivores and vegetarians in the group. The food was great and the whole process could not have been easier. It was wonderful to be able to entertain our friends. The staff at the Fairmont is fantastic. No request is too much trouble. I will be back on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, highest recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: Tkliewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family over spring break. Staff extremely helpful and attentive. Had worked with concierge even prior to arrival to book travel from SFO, and, entire experience was smooth. Two bedroom suite more than enough room for family of 5, and, it was very clean with soft beds. Close to Fisherman's wharf, but, also distant enough to avoid significant traffic. Hotel car helped get to restaurants without problem, and, drivers were very helpful. When plane delayed, staff promptly helped arrange extra night's lodging without problem - really helped decrease travel anxiety. If/when we return to SF, will definitely plan visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Where they act as if they know your name”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-tern
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bed bay view apartment for the first stop on a month long American tour, and had fairly high expectations, having previously stayed at Fairmont properties. However, a month later we still have a glow from a warm and wonderful stay. The apartment was exactly as portrayed on the web site. We were on the 3rd floor looking over the square and rooftops to the Bay and Alcaltraz. Really recommend the bay view - the apartment was very quiet with a balcony that we used daily to watch the cold water swimmers lapping the cove in front. When that got too cold we returned to the gas log fire and cosy lounge. The location was terrific, with bus routes directly in front and the cable car terminal at the back of the Square. We used the hotel car only once, to commence a walk atop Pacific Heights, but the ride was like catching a lift from a friend. Staff are one of the highlights of this Hotel and seem genuinely pleased to see each guest, and all act as if they know you well. All of the hotel areas were spotlessly clean and we had the impression that l the staff enjoyed their work and chatting with guests. A light breakfast is served each morning and my only only wish while staying would be that a tray be available to take breakfast back up to the apartment. The dining area was pleasant but after late nights many guests carried plates of food back to their rooms, and a tray would have been handy. We also joined other guests for wine and cheese on several occasions (4-5pm daily) - very good wine and cheese and knowledgable staff. The lack of a restaurant was not a problem, with 3 restaurants in the Hotel square, Fisherman's Wharf only 5 minutes away with other dining options along the way. Breakfast options are limited if you wish to start the day early but the Hotel breakfast was available from 6am.Only regret was that we didnt avail ourselves of the Hotel offer to have groceries in the apartment when we arrived. The nearest Safeway is approx 15 minutes walk away so we didnt bother to cook, a shame as the kitchen is fully equiped, and the occasional hot breakfast would have been good. All in all, this was a great stay and one of the highlights of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Esquire
Reviews.Content: I went for the weekend wiht my husband. we were given an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite on the 2nd floor with a city view. The service at this hotel is above reproach. This was my second time here and the concierge and the manager both greeted me by name and actually seemed sincere in their pleasure at seeing me again. The rooms are lovely and huge. The complimenary breakfast is very nice. The car is available to take you anywhere you want to go within 3 miles of the hotel and was really appreciated by us. We used it to take us to North Beach, Pier 39 and the Disney Museum in the Presidio. Nice touch. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: bitsandbites
Reviews.Content: Rented a 1-bedroom suite (city view) for 6 nights for my family (wife, 2 daughter, and son) while attending a conference. Was very impressed to be upgraded to a 3-bedroom suite upon arrival (Fairmont President's Club perk), allowing us to each have our own rooms. Not quite a conventional hotel property, but I knew what to expect as I booked it. It is actually a "private residences club", one of six properties that Fairmont manages, in which the primary goal appears to be selling a 10% time share in each suite, while renting out the suites in the meantime until they are all sold. 3 of the 6 properties of this type no longer offer rentals any more, so I suspect this property will end up this way one day. In the meantime...it's a great choice for a stay in San Francisco. Just be aware that there isn't a lunch/dinner option right within the property, although with such a wealth of excellent restaurants nearby, this shouldn't be an issue. The staff were great, very friendly and accommodating. The house car will drop you off and pick you up within a 2km radius of the property (which covers most of downtown San Francisco).
