The continental breakfast is very good - fresh fruit, sumptuous pastries, bread and bagels to toast, yogurt & granola, juice and coffee. I didn't use the fitness facilities, so can't comment on them, except to note that they are temporarily housed in one of the suites, while the regular fitness room is redone. I requested a shuttle to the airport, and they arranged an excellent option, and even pre-arranged the billing, which threw me for a loop, when I tried to pay at SFO, and was told by the driver "don't worry about it, sir". All in all, a very pleasant 6 nights at this property. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dream home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: BusyBees04_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2bdrm suite which was huge and had every amenity any family would require. All staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, they provide a house car to take you anywhere within 2 miles for free, there were 3 flat screen TVs and DVDs and they have an extensive DVD library and provide the popcorn for free too! Water and chocolate provided daily, along with turn down service too. Breakfast was also provided and was a great start to every day and we were able to take some pastries for morning tea too. There is also a free wine and cheese hour everyday with lovely wines and cheeses. The only thing that disturbed out sleep was the constant procession of buses from 5.00 in the morning but we solved this with earplugs, and I think it is only a problem with the western side (as you look at the hotel) room. Can't fault the hotel or the service otherwise. Within walking distance to Fisherman's wharf and cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with pros and cons but on the whole a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterJKJK
Reviews.Content: Considering San Francisco was our first stop in touring America, we unfortunately were slightly disappointed. The weather was no different from England and really it was not the most eye-pleasing of places. However the hotel were welcoming and brought us to attention about the chauffeur options and how breakfast is a lovely international buffet, but no cooked breakfast. Despite this, the rooms when we arrived were lovely. Two storys provided privacy for adults and a good night sleep too. There was a big Television for the kids and at night a nice patio area where we could relax by a fire as San Francisco becomes reasonably cold at that time of night. Overall the hotel was really good and was right next to the famous Ghiradellis square which was really easily accessible. This hotel provided for a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation and service”
Reviews.Author: vanitypear
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-BR Bay view suite for the start of a California touring holiday with our 2 children aged 4 and 20 months. The experience was superb from start to finish - very high quality accommodations, excellent buffet breakfast, courteous service, excellent housekeeping. The hotel recommended restaurants, made reservations at short notice and arranged babysitting for us and we were very happy with the sitter. We made use of the house car, complete with car seats, on a number of occasions. The full kitchen and washer/dryer are enormously useful, and in a good location. We even took our kids to the Peekadoodle play club in the square for an afternoon to burn off steam while we sat and had a coffee. If you are staying for sightseeing and happy to stay in this area of town I cannot recommend this property highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: The3
Reviews.Content: PROS: Amazing loft type apt. which was perfect with a teen (we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom which was heaven), impressive lighting all on dimmers, EXCELLENT location, cable car station across the street, house car that goes just about anywhere, many excellent restaurants close-by, free internet, evening happy hour (1 hour), lovely outside seating areas with fire pits, all the boys working the "door" are awesome, CHOCOLATE! CONS: The street side is VERY noisy, especially in the early morning hours...the harbor side would have made our stay perfect. The free morning "breakfast" is weak. Front desk set-up is not welcoming, and staff could be more friendly. Housekeeping came very late in the afternoon. All in all, wonderful choice.:)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: cosmicstar
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, The room, an appartment that I could happily have moved into, was well equipped, comfortable and spotless with great views of the harbour. An excellent base for sightseeing in a vibrant city. No restaurant but loads of good eateries nearby. parking a bit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: samliz
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Room - an apartment - was fabulous. Spacious, comfortable, stylish. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Loved the private terraces with firepits and views of the bay. Lovely bed with lots of pillows and luxury bathroom. House car will drop you anywhere in the city for a small tip. Expensive - but worth it for a splurge. Look out for special deals.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: This is simply the best hotel we have ever stayed at. I can not rave enough about it. We travelled with our ten month old son and the hotel made a huge difference in our comfort. The rooms are fantastic, clean and spacious. The staff are extremely helpful and nothing is too much to ask from them. There is a courtesy car available for a 2 mile radius transfer which is extremely helpful. Internet is free and available in the rooms. I highly recommend this hotel. Their number one ranking is well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Goldie5882
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and our 7 night stay was one of the best we've had while travelling. We had a Bay view suite booked as a honeymoon gift and it was spacious, luxurious and practical with all available amenities. Breakfast was of good quality. I especially liked the fire in the room, the catalogue of complementary films that could be rented (with free popcorn) - we rented Vertigo in the spirit of San Fran. Obviously the hotel wasn't in Union square, where many of the popular hotels were located, but I found Ghiradelli to have plenty to offer and the cable cars quick and easy to use to get into the main city. The only negative about our stay was the hotel's system difficulty in changing the names on the room from my family's (who booked it for us as a gift) to ours and despite numerous emails before arrival from both myself and the person who booked, clarification on arrival, my stepmother's credit card was charged instead of ours. At a final dicussion, this was changed after 4 days of our stay. That said, the concierge service was attentive and excellent - they booked us many popular and beautiful restaurants including telling one of the nicest that it was our honeymoon - the restaurant subsequently organised us a surprise dinner with complementary courses (Quince by the way - excellent). Also the free house car was quick, easy to use and great when it rained! Overall we loved our stay and would highly recommend it if the bank account stretches that far!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: mkamka
Reviews.Content: I picked up this hotel because it offered suite with a balcony. Both things that were important to us. The place seems to be a regular building with condos which were sold as hotel rooms while being sold. It is a four-story building. The balcony overlooks Ghirardelli Square, upper floors have also view of the bay. There is a very nice observation deck on the second floor with open fireplace and large covered sitting area. The deck was mostly empty, although the weather was not the best either, I suppose it be crowded on the nicer day. The bay view was great - tourist dream. The hotel did not have a bar. There is a convenience store right across the street, which makes up for it. The room was very comfortable, Fashionable design, fireplace, very comfortable bed and pillows, functional layout. A bit too common real estate fashion for my taste, but still very nice. Great room amenities, full kitchen, wine cooler, refrigerator, stove and microwave. Walking distance to everything, somewhat middle between Bay Bridge and Golden Gate, close to water. Staff was very attentive. The serve continental breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the afternoon. I would recommend higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational - the highlight of our US trip”
Reviews.Author: Global_Splash
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in the middle of a round-California trip with two kids aged 8 and 5. The location was superb with Fisherman's Wharf, boats to Alcatraz, traditional cable cars all walking distance away. Service was always attentive, friendly, sincere and efficient. The apartments were beautiful and such a treat to have the kids in their own bedroom after sharing hotel rooms with us elsewhere. The washer and separate dryer were extremely welcome too. Another special part of the hotel is the patio with the open gas fires overlooking the bay. Breakfast was also lovely - continental buffet with lovely pastries and good coffee (hurray!), just right for us. I know other reviews have discussed noise problems - well, it is a lively part of town but I can tell you that despite having an apartment pretty close to the street, we remained unaware of noise and the sink-into-a-cloud beds meant we slept extremely soundly every night. Really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, it was a delight to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy_and_family
Reviews.Content: After staying on Nob Hill last time we were in San Francisco we wanted to stay closer to Fisherman's Wharf this time. We chose the Fairmont Heritage Place largely on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The location is great for sight-seeing and there are lots of good restaurants within an easy walk. As for our three bedroom apartment, it was almost ridiculously well-appointed and comfortable: gorgeous, well-equipped kitchen, spacious living room, good mattresses, three baths, multiple TVs, hardwood floors, and everything gleaming with cleanliness. The staff was among the most pleasant and efficient we've had the pleasure of dealing with anywhere in our travels, without being in any way obtrusive. I should also mention that our kids loved the long list of DVDs they could borrow from the hotel's video library to watch after dinner in the evenings. Although some reviews have mentioned traffic noise, we didn't notice any to speak of from our apartment and slept well each of the several nights we spent here. Bottom line: we will look forward to coming back here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the noisiest hotel rooms ever”
Reviews.Author: SydneyFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: My sister, my two nephews and I stayed here for 5 days on the first leg of a vacation around California. I had booked a 2-bedroom city-view room and had spoken to the hotel prior to arrival to make sure we had a quiet room on a high-floor (away from service delivery areas etc). The pros. Our apartment was large and comfortable and very well equipped. The housekeeping was very good and consistent and management responded quickly to any requests we had. The continental breakfast was well managed and restocked regularly. It's a small hotel so probably not suited to the business traveller but its location makes it perfect for families on vacation. The cons. Our city-view room had no city-view to speak of - all windows overlooked an apartment block. Previous reviews noting the impossibly slow washer/dryer are true. But the big issue we had with this hotel was the noise! The noise of the trucks and street cleaners (between 2am and 4am on some mornings) was impossible. I travel a lot and I have to say this is the noisiest hotel room I have ever stayed in! This hotel has a lot going for it but I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone until they get the windows double-glazed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: JRD56
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel....well worth the price of admission. The location and staff were exceptional. No problems with anything and if you ever needed anything...just ask.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: kcnz
Reviews.Content: It has been a couple of years since I last stayed in San Francisco and though I had liked the Four Seasons there was no compelling reason to go back. Had spent some time looking for a good apartment hotel online when I stumbled across the Fairmont Heritage Place and thought I would give it a go. We were not let down and were absolutely delighted by what we had discovered. We were upgraded from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom suite. The accommodation was very spacious, spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated. The Staff were unobtrusively helpful assisting with transport arrangements as requested. Used the hotel car once, which was most convenient otherwise used buses, taxis, the Bart and cable car. It was with a heavy heart that we packed our bags and made our way back to the airport. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Place”
Reviews.Author: cruiser08_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Heritage Place for 4 nights in late Sept. I work in the travel industry and I wanted to stay at this property because it receives such rave reviews. I've seen and experienced a lot of luxury properties, but this one is the best I've ever seen. We had a 2 bedroom unit with a city view and could not believe the size of our 'residence'. It was over 1400 sq ft. From the moment we arrived to check in until we left everyone of the staff at this property far exceeded our expectations. The washer and dryer were great and they even gave us all of the laundry soap that we needed. They didn't even want us to have to load or unload our own dishwasher! We had 2 1/1 baths, 2 Master Suites, a gasfireplace, and 3 large flat screen televisions complete with unbelievable audio. and video components. The option of the Lexus SUV to take us around the area was great. SF can be difficult to get a cab in, but all we had to do was call the hotel and they would send the car for us. It is on a first come first serve basis, but we never had to wait more than 5 minutes. They will transport you in a 2 mile radius of the hotel which covers Fisherman's Wharf and the Union Square area. The outdoor deck with the gas firepit was amazing! Very comfortable and great views of the Bay. If you're looking for a good deal on dinner, check out the Mc Cormick and Kuletos Restaurant behind the hotel in Ghiradelli Square. They serve $2.95 cheeseburgers during Happy Hour from 3-6 Mon- Thurs. Great food and a great value for SF. We loved this place and i would heartily recommend it to anyone. The only negative was actually having to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jackiebaptist
Reviews.Content: this hotel is pure luxury, the room was wonderful, views are great. We had a great time in SF staying here. I would highly recommend it to all my friends, as a destination hotel in SF. Room service was also wonderful, we ordered breakfast and enjoyed the pancakes and fruit. happy hour was also fun

Reviews.Title: “I'd move in tomorrow if I could”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: After reading all the gushing reviews about this place I wasn't sure it would live up to the hype. But it did. When we arrived we found out we'd been upgraded to a two-bedroom suit. We weren't sure this constituted an actual upgrade, since we had no need for a second bedroom, and would have preferred a higher floor. As it turned out, though, being at street level was fine. It wasn't at all noisy. It's a short walk from the touristy area, but far enough away from all the noise. Our suite was...well, it bordered on absurd. If it were a loft on the market in my city I'd probably have bought it. Full kitchen (and I mean full -- Wolf gas grill, microwave, convection oven, dishwasher, basin sink, wine cooler, dishes, utensils, dining table, the works -- and living room, including sound that could be piped in to the other rooms. Two full bedrooms and bathrooms. Since we had the space we just stuck our bags in the second bedroom and let the staff know they didn't need to turn down those beds. If you have a family, there is probably no better place for you than this. You could cook dinners and prepare lunches here for a week (they'll even buy groceries in advance of your arrival), or if you're tired of cooking they'll deliver from any of the restaurants in Ghirardelli Square....which is right out the back door. The staff was incredible...from the host at the free wine tasting each afternoon to the concierge who booked our Alcatraz tickets to the gents who drove us around the city in the house car (a Lexus SUV) to the people making sure you had everything you needed at breakfast, they never missed a beat. Finally, and maybe best of all: the second-floor terrace overlooking the bay. It was a little cold in San Francisco the weekend we visited, all the more reason to pull some chairs up to the fire pit, open up a bottle of wine and a good book and look out over the city. We spent a lot of time up there, and even got a free hot dog from an employee who was cooking for a private event further down the terrace. Hopefully that doesn't get him in trouble...I just don't think the staff there knows how to say "no" to a guest. I could not recommend this place more highly.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: franc0phile75
Reviews.Content: I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Our suite was incredible. I used to work for an online hotel agency and have been to loads of very nice places, but nothing like this. Everything from was 5*+, and even so, the service stands out. They could not do enough for us. Our house is being renovated and we've been living in a building site for two months. We spent the last three nights of our two week trip to California here, and we spent most of our nights in, enjoying the livingroom and the DVDs they brought us, with cold beer from the fridge. (Jesus it was a shock coming back home to all the dust and mess in our house) An excellent way to end our trip. The room rate was proportionally expensive to the service, but we booked months in advance and got a stay 3 pay 2 deal on their website. That made the final price not that much more than our B&B in Napa, hence the 5* value rating above.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!!!! - did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: JTGLS
Reviews.Content: So many wonderful things to say about this hotel and the experience we had there. We booked a one bedroom suite and when we checked in were upgraded to a two bedroom apartment. Amazing staff (this includes everyone reception, concierge, housekeeping etc etc), beautiful and clean apartments, fantastic facilities, brilliant location and easily the best hotel we stayed out in the US out of the 8 hotels we booked throughout our holiday. We were traveling with our 8 year old and 1 year old and the fact that the rooms had a front loader, dryer, microwave and two separate bedrooms within the apartment was absolutely priceless to us. Another amazing facility was the concierge car - instead of hailing a taxi the complimentary concierge car and drive would drive you to or from your destination (the rule was it had to be within 5km from the hotel I think). We used this day and night and found it so handy. The only complaint I would have (and because of how wonderful this hotel was it as easily ignored) was that our bedrooms faced the road and the windows were not sound proofed at all as the night traffic noise was really really loud. Although this hotel is on the pricier side of things it was absolutely brilliant value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here as our first port of call...”
Reviews.Author: Rush&Min
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first port of call on our west coast adventure! It was brilliant! We had a 2 bed suite and it accomodated ua perfectly! We stayed here with our two little ones and the jet lag was a killer. Thankfully we had a fully functioning kitchen, so at 4/5am I could make breakfast and coffee. Dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, were all used!! It was lovely place ESP with two little ones & Ghiradelli chocolate shop on your doorstep isn't bad at all. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectaions”
Reviews.Author: Bet46
Reviews.Content: We travel to a different location every year as a family group. This had to be one of the most memorable . The staff at the hotel have manners extrordinaire. There is nothing that you ask for that is out of the question. The hotel itself turned out to be exactly as the pictures showed on the website, spectacular! We had a three bedroom residence on the third floor that was modern, spacious, comfortable and immaculate. There was a complimentary Continental Breakfast every morning and wine and cheese in the afternoon that we were unaware of and a VERY pleasant surprise. The beds were turned down every evening with a Ghiradelli chocolate and a weather forcast for the next day on your pillow and a bottle of water at your bedside. The location is perfect. A close walk to Fishermans Wharf and not right in the middle of all the hectic traffic. As one of the other reviews stated this hotel ruins it for all the rest. All seven of our group would absolutley stay here again and highly recomend it to anyone wishing for a wonderful experience in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in the Bay Area”
Reviews.Author: PaulWHanson
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been happier with my stay at this property. The location is perfect, the service is impeccable and the stay is worth every penny. First, the location. You're in Ghirardelli Square, so you have great shopping and food right outside your front door. Not to mention the greatest hot cocoa I've ever had at the Ghirardelli Cafe. Outside of that, you're just a minute or two walk from the cable car turnaround, which can take you to Chinatown, Lombard Street, Nob Hill and Union Square. Fisherman's Wharf is also just a few blocks to the east, so there's plenty to do there as well. Next, the service. All of the staff were extemely helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions, stuff to do, etc. They all make you feel valued to be a guest. The courtesy car is a great feature of the hotel. We often wandered around town and then called for the car to pick us up when we wanted to come "home." And, oh, the amenities. The Business Center was top notch and very private for me to get some work done. The evening wine and cheese tastings were a lot of fun, and gave us the opportunity to mingle with other guests. The complimentary breakfast was better than expected (bagels, pastries, yogurt, granola, etc.) and perfect for taking back to your room for a sit down breakfast. The terraces were my favorite, though. There were two - one small one off the lounge and a large one overlooking the bay off the second floor. Both had large natural gas firepits that were the perfect complement to the cool Bay evenings. I could have spent my entire vacation reading and watching the Bay from atop Ghirardelli Square! And let's not forget the rooms. Our room was immaculate, and provided everything we needed: dishwasher, stove cooktop, washer/dryer, silverware and plates - it was like having our own apartment on the waterfront! Bottom line - I hope this place doesn't sell out before I can return to San Francisco. We loved every moment of our stay and would encourage everyone to give it a try. It's so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Condo Style!”
Reviews.Author: Outbeyond
Reviews.Content: We pulled up in the taxi from the airport in late August and a very friendly doorman approached, opened the car doors and said a hearty welcome. We entered the sedate-looking brick building and the lobby was incredibly calm and sparing...hmm, I thought. Then a couple of well-mannered, friendly Fairmont staffers immediately greeted us and gave us the lowdown about the one-bedroom cityview unit I'd booked at a comparatively low price several months earlier (less than $350) for me and my two teenagers in tow...and then staff proceeded to tell me we'd been upgraded at no cost to a two-bedroom cityview unit! Yo! Well, OK! We were pleased, without question! The building is more like a condominium property than a hotel, so it's rather quiet and there aren't tons of folks hanging around. I liked that. And then the unit itself, well, it was gorgeous. The full kitchen gleamed, with a center isle and sufficient pots and pans, silverware, dishes, a medium-sized drawer-type refrigerator, an icemaker and a small dishwasher (I rarely used any of this stuff except for tea-making!), The living room was genuinely spacious and comfortable with a lovely couch and a few chairs and a big ol' flat screen TV atop a gas fireplace. The bedrooms were also quite spacious and each had its own large TV and bathroom - one, even, with a jet-stream-type tub...VERY nice! I like firm mattresses and these were a tad bit less than firm, but my teens thought the beds heavenly, so I'm sure you will, too! We also loved the continental breakfast...boiled eggs, pastries, toast, fresh fruits, orange juice, milk were the major offerings and, of course, coffee and tea. The late afternoon 4pm-5pm refreshment bar of red/white wines and sodas and cheeses/crackers was also a nice touch. Again, it seemed like there were never many folks around, although we knew there were...they just - like us - stayed largely in their own units and enjoyed the amenities there! However, note that the property also has a great deck facing the San Francisco waters and this deck has lovely firepits in the evening that blaze seemingly all night, with plenty of outdoor furniture on which to lounge about... One of the best features of the Fairmont is that it's intimately connected to the Ghirardelli Square shopping square...a small, high-end place with lots of fun little shops and wine-tasting places and some good restaurants. This square was extremely close to the water and within immediate walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf. What's not to like???!!! We loved it and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The Fairmont town car came in very handy when my teens decided to catch a night movie in the city. The staff's attention to ensuring their safe arrival and pick-up was much appreciated by me. The only downside of note, and there was only one and I feel like I should mention it to be genuine, was that the city view wasn't exactly a skyline-type view...it was of smaller-type rowhouses immediately across the street. Now we were on the second floor, so keep that in mind. It wasn't a Ghirardelli Square high-end-type view, but it wasn't bad, either. And the windows have some super nice curtains including pulldowns that let light in but keep outsider viewers out. I easily found ways to arrange these to my absolute satisfaction. So book yourself in this place, without hesitation! Would we return...you bet we would!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - Except for Dust and Noise”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTrish
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Fairmont Heritage Place based on Trip Advisor reviews and as Fairmont President's Club Member - I had read about the venue. We wanted to create a very special trip for our family friends who were visiting from Canada, so we went all out. The place was fantastic in almost every way. The pre-trip concierge service was amazing - everything that I requested was perfect. They went out of their way. The welcome was top notch. we were greated in the room with Champagne and Chocolate Dipped Strawberries for our friends Anniversary - a wow for sure. The suite was gorgeous - two bedroom on the 3rd floor. Exquisite design, great kitchen with everything you need. Nice tvs, sound systems, DVDs etc. The daily breakfast was plus - everything was fresh and yummy. The complimentry car service was a plus - we barely used our car. The $50 a day valet was not so nice but typical for the city. The only things that prevented me from giving it a 5 star rating was that there was a heap of dust behind the master bedroom bed and all of the fixtures in the bathroom were really dusty - I am not THAT picky but for the $$$ this could have been taken care of. The other issue was that in rooms that back on to North Point Road are crazy noisy - I had to pull out ear plugs or there was no sleeping - I let the concierge know about both things - but he was not that phased by it??? No service recovery whatsoever - hmmm - That was not 5 star - Regardless I will come back to this venue with hope that these areas have improved

Reviews.Title: “Do no stay here - I don't want to share this hotel with anyone else.”
Reviews.Author: blnk
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here, it was terrible. It is not that the hotel was bad, in fact the experience was incredible. The problem is that it was so good, that I will never be able to stay anywhere else again. The rooms were huge and had everything one could need, the breakfast was a great way to start the day, the location cannot be beat, the facilities were top notch and the staff were genuinely working toward making your stay better. This hotel is my goldstandard for travel with kids in a city. If there is one area of improvement, it is in the city so the outside noise can be loud, but you are in the city so that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: JPP11
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. First, the staff are excellent. Secondly, a great unexpected continental buffet that is very well done. Great rooms with lots of room that are in great condition and a wonderful retreat after a long day of climbing up and down. Lots of great restaurants within 10 minutes by taxi. I recommend going up Hyde to Jackson and working your way down. Start with the Hyde Street Seafood House and order the Lobster Bisque! You can have a great stroll back to the Hotel (downhill!) after dinner. Take the Hyde street streetcar or cab on the way there though as it is uphill. There are also 5 other great places to eat on Hyde Street between the Hotel and Jackson. Being in the square and away from Fisherman's Wharf is great. We love this part of San Francisco because it is away from all the noise of downtown and the Wharf. Great location! We will stay at this Hotel again, and maybe never another one!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: wutnik
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two girl friends in a two bedroom suite for a long weekend in San Francisco at the Fairmont Heritage Place Ghiradelli Square. I have not, nor likely will ever stay somewhere so unbelievably nice. The suite was enormous and had a kitchen, living area, two bedrooms, 3 bathrooms and laundry facilities. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes and glassware along with a huge dining table. The living area had a big screen tv and stereo system with satellite radio. Each bedroom had a full (amazing and spacious) bathroom along with flat screen tv. We had a lovely view as well looking on to the square. I also canâ€™t say enough about the location. We were able to easily walk to the Wharf and shopping. We walked and walked and walked everywhere! The hotel had a lovely breakfast in the morning which we had in the sunshine by the fire pit overlooking the square. We also enjoyed a wine and cheese party one afternoon. That day was a bit cooler so they even provided blankets as we sat by the fire with our wine. Absolutely the finest hotel in my opinion with an unbeatable location!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, wonderful service, very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kasinda M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Heritage Place for a kid-free weekend getaway with 2 other couples & it was perfect! It has the best location in Ghiradelli Square with an amazing view of the bay & very close to many restaurants & shops, and Fisherman's Wharf (but not too close). The staff was very helpful & friendly. We utilized the house car multiple times during our 3 night stay-it was extremely convenient. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit & it was perfect. 3 bedrooms each with their own bathroom and the kitchen/dining & living room. Everything was very clean & beautifully decorated-felt more like a home than hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Luxury, and Service”
Reviews.Author: mamfitz
Reviews.Content: It's a luxury apartment at fisherman's wharf. This is not a hotel room. It was great for our family of four (one bedroom apartment) as a central location to explore san fran and the surrounding areas. Easy to take a break from the hectic days and relax for a few hours before starting another adventure. The hotel car, wine receptions, and continental breakfasts were simple but well utilized by our family. It is pricey but at the end of a 10 day northern california trip, we needed some extra room as well as a washer/dryer. It's hard to imagine anything that could have been better here. You could quietyly relax in the room or on the balconies, enjoy the great view of the bay, be in the middle of activity in the wharf area and/or walk to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “bumped one night but the night at ghirardelli was great”
Reviews.Author: skingKansas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful and the location was perfect!! We were supposed to stay 2 nights, but got bumped to the other Fairmont on their tab (very generous) which was fine, but the 2 hotels aren't really comparable. We would've loved to have stayed longer at this location as it was perfect in size of room, amenities, and location. . All the other 3 hotels we stayed in during our California trip did not even come close to the classiness of this one.

Reviews.Title: “SF was cold but the trip was worth staying at the Fairmont Heritage Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gate32
Reviews.Content: We heard San Francisco was cold in the summer but did not expect the weather to be this chilly. Still we had a wonderful time in the "city by the bay" and had a FANTASTIC time at the Fairmont Heritage Place, Ghirardelli Square! We spent considerable time on Tripadvisor researching the best hotels to stay at and of course we heard so much about this place and had to give it a try. We usually stay around the Union Square for the conveniences of shopping and we just liked that area...until now. There is something very different about this hotel and it could be due to the size as every interaction with the staff seems so personable. We are not just another guest checking in or out, and they actually remember our names and faces. Every time we walked in and out of the front door, we were greeted with "welcome back" or "have a great day!" In this day and age, after being de-humanized at airport security, standing in long line ups waiting and then finally making it to your vacation destination, it feels GREAT to be PAMPERED and recognized as a valuable person again. I would recommend the Fairmont Heritage Place to anyone traveling to San Francisco. I would also recommend you bring a sweater too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: Dracodad
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel was perfect for our trip to CA, as we were staying in SF at the midway point, and lo and behold, these lovely condos have washer and dryer (note that these are energy efficient ones that take a looonnnggg time to run and get the clothes mostly dry, but they were still a washer and dryer!). We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath 4th floor room that was very elegant and clean. Location was ideal, with Ghiardellli Square right outside, and we walked to Pier 33 in about 20 minutes. The trolley cars start within a 2 min walk and there are loads of restaurants and shops around. The room 2 king bedrooms with huge bathrooms, and the couchbed was as comfy as they come. The living room had a fireplace, TV and built-in surround sound and the full kitchen included a wine chiller. Wine and cheese each night and a nice breakfast each morning. Wonderful service including 2 vehicles that take you where you need to go. Only real negative was the loud sounds from the street, despite being on the 4th floor, but remember, this is an old factory building. It wasn't too bad but woke us up at least once each night. Also one bedroom stayed cooler than the others, due to being on a corner. But these are minor points and we would 100% stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on staying there even with a longstanding reservation”
Reviews.Author: shenn
Reviews.Content: We made reservations to stay at the Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square over 4 months ago. We carefully chose that location because of its walking proximity to what we wanted to see, as well as its amenities (kitchen, laundry, etc) which fit the needs of our young family. We had read the TripAdvisor reviews and were very excited about our upcoming stay there. Then 48 hours before our arrival we were contacted by Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square and told that they were overbooked. They were moving us to the Fairmont at Nob Hill. We tried to speak of it to them in terms of moving us being a choice for us to do or not, but it became clear to us that despite our longstanding reservation that they did not particularly see it that way. To their credit they arranged for us to stay at the Fairmont at Nob Hill and they picked up the room charge. Was that generous on their part? Yes, it most certainly was generous. Was staying at the Fairmont Nob Hill a convenient or satisfying experience for us? No, it was not. If we had wanted to stay at a business oriented hotel, not within walking distance to many major attractions, without en suite kitchen or laundry, and not particularly friendly to young children -- then we would have booked at the Fairmont Nob Hill in the first place. I am not implying the Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square was not generous in agreeing to pick up the hotel charges for the less luxurious and more inconvenient accommodations they provided to us. They were. I appreciate that many hotels would not have done as much. However, we were never given the courtesy of even being told why our reservation of 4 months was not being honored. Instead the tone from the Ghirardelli was more one of we should be content with what they chose to give us. It is that aspect that seems quite inconsistent with a #1 rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We have just left after a great 5 night...”
Reviews.Author: nnwj
Reviews.Content: We have just left after a great 5 night stay at this hotel. We got upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite from our original booking of a 1 bedroom so were really spoilt. From prearrival questions such as transfers from airport and any grocery requirements to the suggestions of itinerary the staff could not have been thoughtful enough. The location is great too. Breakfast was good and the possibility to take back to the residence was great for small children. Only thing I would say is that if you are a very light sleeper I would suggest a bay view room, north point road is reasonably busy. Perfect hotel, perfect staff thoroughly deserves it's rating. Ps there is also a small Fitness area, 3 treadmills, cross trainer plus weights etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wouldn't rush back”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller059
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after it's rave reviews on Trip Advisor. While it is a very nice Hotel and the rooms are lovely I felt it overpriced compared to other Hotels we stayed in while in the States. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were comfortable I didn't feel the location was the best. It is very close to Fishermans Wharf which was a let down. Very dirty and a lot of beggars and homeless people. Next time I will stay up around Union Square which is more close to the action and better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: nicejan
Reviews.Content: After reading reports of this property I had to stay here. I am a big fan of Fairmont Hotels anyway and have stayed in a couple before so I had high expectations and this hotel did not disappoint. Rooms aree spacious with beautiful decor and great amenities which can be a chllenge in buildings over 100 years old. The the views of San Francisco Bay is lovely and the amenities of Ghiradelli Square with an array of restaurants and shops at the doorstep. They have a pleasant outdoor area with fire pits and comfy furniture. Next time I'm coming back with the girls and will leave the husband at home!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hertiage Place, San Fran...impressed beyond words!”
Reviews.Author: hc437
Reviews.Content: There is reason that the Fairmont Hertiage Place is thenumber 1 top rated in place to stay while in San Francisco based on reviewers who have stayed there. After staying there I now know why....the amenities, the value and especially the service are all incredible! Let me expain. Earlier in June, I emailed their housekeeping department to find out where I could buy the excellent tins of custom Illy coffee the Fairmont Heritage offers it's in suite guests. The women incharge of housekeeping, Suwen, replied and asked me for my address to which I gave. Well, I arrived at my home the other day and to my surprise I was greeted by a nice little Fed Ex package. I eagerly brought it inside... looked at the Fairmont Ghirardelli return address with her name on it, felt the weight of the package and said oh my goodness! When I opened the carefully wrapped package- to my surprise, amazement and utter gratitude were quite a few silver cans of IIly Custom Espresso roasted ground coffee...Christmas had arrived in June!! Wow! I just wanted to tell everyone how much their effort and gesture has meant to me and my envious friends who ooggled those beautiful silver tins of Illy coffee. I don't know how the Fairmont picks and trains for customer service excellence such as this but it is working BIG TIME! My families entire experience while at the Fairmont Ghirardelli Square, San Francisco- was wonderful, their staff seemed to anticipate my families needs and acted with poise and grace through out our stay. That unexpected kind gesture left me impressed beyond words! Well done and thank you so much, Suwen! Gestures such as hers- taking the time to answer my email question, then arrange, pack, wrap and mail a parcel is simply extra-ordinary in a difficult economic time when everyone seems bent on every corner cutting corners just to save a buck. Their actions show great level of commitment to the fine craft of hospitality and I'm in gratitude! This kind of service was not isolated as we frequently experienced a geniune sense of hospitality; from a 25 min a manager spent over the phone patiently answering my planning questions, never in a rush or hurry, to all the floor staff greeting with a warm courteous smile. If you enjoy this sense of luxury and hospitality its no wonder the Fairmont Heritage Place outshines & is number 1. Well done & Kudos to everyone at the Fairmont Heritage Ghirardelli!

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience!”
Reviews.Author: DrMac27126
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom apt. For the fourth of July week and we enjoyed it immensely primarily because of the outstanding service by the staff. From the butler, valet, concierge, these are examples for others to follow. They anticipated our needs beyond expectations. We were attending a wedding and my mother in law who was staying with us had significant physical limitations so my nephews nieces wanted to show their kids to her and so I said fine just stagger it over a period of a couple of hours expecting us to host 5 couples over this period. For some reason a total of 25 people showed up at the same time and I panicked. The staff was unflustered and accommodated us with nary a blink. I could not believe how well these guys treated us I will make it a point to recommend this hotel from now on. I think it's not just the location or space but the staff which won my business. A can do attitude to exceed is a rare thing in any business.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfection exists and it's the Fairmont Ghirardelli”
Reviews.Author: gwh_SF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in San Francisco and had the pleasure of staying there for the weekend of our wedding. We chose the Fairmont because of it's proximity to our wedding venue and because each suite (1,2, or 3 bedroom) has a kitchen with a large dining and living space. During our stay, we discovered many more reasons why this is the place to stay if you're visiting San Francisco. -Location. Right at Ghirardelli Square. Although I'm not a fan of tourist traps, Ghirardelli square feels different. The hotel has outdoor and indoor spaces that take full advantage of the views of the bay. Whether you take advantage of being close to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square, the views are spectacular. -Amenities. Beautiful fire pits and common areas. Attentive concierge. Wonderful fruit and continental breakfast every morning. -Spacious units. Well appointed with every detail well thought out. A fully functional kitchen where you could easily make your own meals and entertain. The units are furnished with character and a modern clean style. As you'd expect from the Fairmont, the beds, linens, and bathrooms were of the highest quality. -Value. Not something I would have expected, but if you're traveling with kids, a two bedroom unit at the Fairmont may be the best value in San Francisco. Even if you're not traveling with kids, for the quality, space, and setting, the Fairmont Ghirardelli is tough to beat. In sum, the Fairmont Ghirardelli combines style, service, space, ambience, comfort, and value for the quintessential San Francisco experience. This is the place we recommend to our friends and family who visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “How do you describe perfect”
Reviews.Author: JoJosontheroad
Reviews.Content: Wow. My family of 5 stayed here for two nights during a whirlwind Napa to Santa Monica tour of California. We booked a 2 bedroom suite, but were upgraded to a 3 bedroom unit which really fit the bill. The location was perfect, close to all the tourist traps that our girls loved and right above the Ghiradelli Ice Cream shop. The breakfast buffet was ample and we really enjoyed having our muffins and coffee on the terrace overlooking the square. The service was prompt and helpful especially when we had problems with the in-unit washer and dryer. The kids loved the free DVD rentals and the beautiful terrace with fire place that we enjoyed on both nights as we watched the sun set over the Golden gate Bridge. WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE !!! Even if we had not been upgraded, this place would have been worth the price

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite in The City”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaThompson
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Heritage Ghirardelli is everything and more. Check in was very quick and pleasant. We were escorted to our balcony view room, #214. The view is wonderful and the residence has everything you could need. The amenities free transportation within 2 mile radius in Lexus SUV, Butler service, Grocery shopping call 24 hours prior to arrival and it will be in your room, 500 DVD to use, Morning breakfast is included and very nice and Evening wine reception is only one hour. No restaurant on site youâ€™re at Ghirardelli Square where there are wonderful restaurants outside your door. The room service is from the restaurants at Ghirardelli Square $25 delivery fee plus 20% service charge. The only negative is the room is not sound proof, you can hear people in hallway and housekeeping in the morning cleaning residence next door. I love city noises and enjoyed the live music filtering in the room off the balcony this afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased”
Reviews.Author: traveladvice4
Reviews.Content: I wholeheartedly agree with prior posts recommending this property. The rooms are luxurious and the staff is friendly and helpful. The property provided complimentary breakfast to all guests and a nightly reception offering wine and light snacks. All hotel personnel were very friendly to the family. I would highly recommend this property to all who are contemplating a trip to the Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateH2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Magellan Vacations and it totally exceeded our expectations. When we checked in our room was upgraded to an ocean view. My husband was delighted to discover a large deck off our room where he could enjoy a cigar. The unit was so well equipped (Wine, Martini Glasses, Satellite TV) we felt completely at home. Having a complete kitchen made it easy for sterilizing bottles and traveling with a 10 week old baby. The hotel provided a very nice wooden crib along with baby toiletries. There is a gorgeous wine shop in Ghirardelli Square that is definitely worth checking out. It is an easy walk from the hotel to Safeway if you are interested in cooking your own meals. The hotel provides on a first come first serve basis a town car to take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius. For me the real bonus was the hotel having on hand an infant car seat as it is impossible to get a taxi with a car seat. We enjoyed the fresh fruit provided with the continental breakfast. All the hotel employees were helpful and very courteous. We look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They went out of the way to correct a mistake”
Reviews.Author: ATravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation snafoo at the Fairmont last year. They gave us a free night to come back. We spent the weekend there this last weekend and we were so impressed. The location was very fun. The rooms perfect. The staff very helpful and polite. Someone yelled at an attendant on the street and he handled it with politeness and calm. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top”
Reviews.Author: banditbandit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there at the end of April and were both impressed. From the moment you walk in you are treated like royalty. The customer service was fantastic. As far as the hotel goes, you feel like you are at home. The best hotel I ve ever stayed at, and I have stayed at several 5 stars, you will not regret it, Take advantage of the wine tasting, breakfast, and car service.

Reviews.Title: “simply, The Best !!! made our trip !”
Reviews.Author: travelalot015
Reviews.Content: a great joy ! Pay attention to the stimulus package , in which the third night is free, Great location , the best place for families. Free Dvd's from a huge list of movies. You won't need a car since they hold a van for the guests' use (for drives of up to 2 miles). Free High speed internet. Very nice and helpful staff. We travel a lot, but never stayed in such a pleasent place !

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family stay”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a family vacation. While the property is nice and pretty new, most of the the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and did whatever they could to improve our stay. Location is great if you want a bay view and enjoy the wharf. I preferred the location of the Fairmont Beacon hill when I was traveling without kids ! Make sure when you reserve to ask for a room with double glass windows: For the night price, you should be able to enjoy a quite night. The hotel is at a corner with traffic lights and the bus traffic may be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: stixy386
Reviews.Content: This property was wonderful. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom that was huge. It was would be perfect for a family or 2 couples. The master bedroom included a shower and soaking tub wet area that was great. We had a bayview but no terrace. The view from the windows were of the bay and alcatraz. The only minor complaint would be that they are doing construction outside the windows, when they are closed you can't really notice it. You could hear it a little in the morning but nothing too disturbing. We were in the mustard building that had a common terrace overlooking the square. The other terrace overlooked the square and the water and both were great for a glass of wine or ice cream sundae! The location was perfect for us, we were able to take walks along the water to the Wharf, Ferry Building and even walked back from At&t park. For short trips to house car took us to North Beach and the Financial districts for dinner, they even picked us up when we called. The staff was amazing, they would look up restaurants for us, even call them to check if there was a wait. I also can't say enough about everyone in San Francisco, I have never met so many nice and friendly people! The trip was wonderful and anyone would love this hotel. Don't hesitate to contact me with any questions. On another note we took the full day Napa tour with "Max Napa Tours" and it was truly memorable, if you want a semi-private and laid back Napa experience definetly book with Max!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: jamhog
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Fairmont for four nights and loved every minute. The accomodations were fantastic and so was the service. We had a two bedroom bay view that was beautiful and very clean. I am a picky, germaphobe and I felt so comfortable here. We are used to Manhattan prices so for us this was quite a deal. The new 7 passensger Lexus drove us wherever we wanted to go within a 2 mile radius. Every employee greeted us with a smile and seemed to be very happy. Breakfast was complimentary and consisted of bagels/toast/gronola/yogurt/fresh fruit and pastries. My children (12,9,6) LOVED staying here and loved San Francisco. The location was great and we would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: G00mbagirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was WONDERFUL. The beds are oh so comfy. Made it hard to leave the room to enjoy the city. Really enjoyed the fruit on the complimentary continental breakfast. Was impressed with the hotels large DVD selection that is regularly updated with new releases. They even provide complimentary popcorn with the DVD rentals. How fun. The concierges were very helpful - although we would have appreciated some more creative restaurant suggestions other than the obvious tourist-trap recommendatoins (Ex. Scoma's and the like). Would love an opportunity to go back to San Francisco and stay at the Fairmont Heritage Square again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better.”
Reviews.Author: TxTree
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairmont Ghirardelli Square during a 4-day visit to SF with our 2 young sons. This place was really the ideal spot for a family vacation. The view from our room (Alcatraz) was gorgeous and the property very well designed. We had all the comforts of home with none of the worries. And the staff were super thoughtful and accommodating. I'm a picky traveler and even I was impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value for families”
Reviews.Author: superfila
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square is a great hotel (it's a timeshare that also rents rooms out as a hotel), and an excellent value for families. The hotel features 1, 2, and 3 bedroom suites which are basically fully furnished luxury city apartments. At the time we were booking, a 2 bedroom suite at the Fairmont Ghirardelli was priced slightly less than 2 connecting rooms and a lot less than a 2 bed suite at a comparable hotel in the city. If this is still the case, this represents an excellent value for families looking for 2 or 3 bedroom suites. The selling point of this hotel is the outstanding quality of the rooms. The single level suites are decorated in contemporary/modern style with granite countertops throughout, modern kitchen appliances (dishwasher, full size microwave/oven, stove, wine fridge, full sink, toaster, coffee maker, full set of stemware, full set of porcelain china, flatware, cooking knives, etc - probably better equipped than your own kitchen), baths with separated toilet (WC), spacious tubs and showers with excellent water pressure & temp, outstanding beds and linens/pillows (super comfortable, better than W Heavenly), and in-unit washer/dryer. Living room is very spacious with gas faux fireplace and all units (it seemed) have their own generous balconies. Didn't have any issues with sound from neighbors. You could hear other family members within the suite between rooms, but it was manageable. The service at the Fairmont is pretty darn good. They try really hard to exceed your expectations, and everyone really steps up to meet your needs without a single complaint. The only issue I had was that the housekeeping during my stay only cleaned beds and bathrooms, didn't straighten up living room or kitchen. Location is unbeatable for tourists - you are in Ghirardelli Square, steps away from the Pier, Marina, GG Bridge. Kind of far from nearest BART station, but the hotel has a car (Maserati) which will take you to/from the BART. Free continental breakfast every morning with a good selection of pastries and such was much appreciated. Guests who join their frequent traveller club (Presidents Club) get free in-room Internet and free local calls. Valet parking is $50/night. Overall, an excellent hotel, and for now, also an excellent value. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: NapaVaca
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to CA for his birthday. In my future trips to the San Francisco area I will not stay anywhere else. The service at this hotel is unlike anything I have ever experienced. We arrived at the hotel 4 hours early and they let us check in. They also upgraded our room from a one to a two bedroom bay view. The view was beautiful. JB, one of the valet men was very helpful. He drove us to our lunch destination and offered to pick us up in the house car. Unfortunately we were only able to stay one night here, but we will definitely be back. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups/families!”
Reviews.Author: MrsZiggy
Reviews.Content: My dad just turned 70 so all the kids flew in to spend a long weekend in San Fran together. I think my mom picked the place and she said it was supposed to be pretty neat.... Holy Mother of Understatements! Its in ghirardelli square with all the other shops, wine bars, and resturants, and only a few blocks from fishermans wharf... but we walked in and thought "Who needs to leave the hotel!?" The rooms were beautifully done, modern elegant and had everything we needed - included a super helpful concierge staff that helped out with questions, cabs, and reservations. The rooms were set up as condos, so everyone had their own room and no one had to sleep on the couch or fight over a bathroom. Breakfast in the morning was simple, but fresh and free! And its worth it to make it back to the hotel between 4-5pm for the free wine tasting - loved the malbec! The only thing that could make it better would be a pool/hot tub (which I believe is on the way in their new spa renovations).

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: buenasvacaciones
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights here with my family over the Christmas holiday. The time passed much too quickly - we all would have loved to have stayed longer. This is the perfect hotel for family groups and friends to be together. We experienced outstanding levels of service during our stay - from Front desk to housekeeping staff - everyone seemed willing to go that extra mile. We asked for a Christmas tree on arrival and even though it was 22nd Dec and trees were hard to come by, a beautiful tree was delivered within a couple of hours. Our spacious 2 bedroom residence with fabulous views of the bay came with every amenity we could wish for including state of the art kitchen, closets that lit up when you opened the doors, huge wall mounted flat screen TVs and a gas log fire in the lounge. The modern loft style decor is stunning with dark wooden floors in the living area, high ceilings, track lighting, big windows and exposed brick work. The kitchen is supplied with coffee, tea, milk and sugar. There is aslo an ample supply of dishwasher powder,paper towels and washing powder (the residence comes with a washing machine and tumble dryer). There were 2 en suite shower rooms and a further downstairs toilet. There is no need to cook if you prefer not to as there are several restaurants at Ghirardelli square and Fishermans Wharf is a short stroll away. The hotel provides a complimentary continental breakfast. I stayed in 2 other luxury hotels in San Francisco during my visit and neither came close to the Fairmont Heritage. It is simply the best. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: There is little more to say about this hotel other than it is absolutely superb. For some reason they gave me a unit with two rooms, and one could easily get lost... State of the art appliances, first class amenities, helpful and unobtrusive staff. And the view of Alcatraz from my room was amazing! It must be said that their free breakfast is a real continental offer with fresh juices, cereals and fruit, not the ordinary coffee and pastries offered at some other places. Fisherman Wharf itself is not that attractive, with an endless row of souvenir stores. But you do get a wide choice of very good restaurants nearby, on all price ranges, which the staff will be happy to reserve for you. Would love to go back here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “we never left the room”
Reviews.Author: ryancass
Reviews.Content: My sister and our boyfriends shared a two bedroom suite over Valentines day and were very pleasantly surprised. I am a travel agent so I do have the opportunity to see many properties all around the world. We took a risk trying this hotel as it had just opened a couple months earlier and we didn't have any feedback on it. The taxi's did not know exactly where it was (thinking we were referring to the downtown Fairmont)- Just mentioned Ghirardelli Square and they found their way. The unit was very spacious with two bedrooms. There is enough privacy as one bedroom is lofted on the 2nd floor, and the 2nd bedroom is on the main floor. Both have full bathrooms connected to the bedroom- plus an extra ensuite off the foyer. There is a fully equipped kitchen (not kitchenette..KITCHEN along with all the utensils/ dishes), a large 8 person table and a living room with large couches, flat screen tvs and a great view of the Bay. The hotel did have some amenities however we didn't use these as the weather didn't permit. There is a nice fire pit outside, that looks like it would be a great relaxing spot in the warmer months. One stairwell takes you right out to Ghirardelli Square, amongst all the shops, restaurants, coffee shops... you have a short cut just for Fairmont Guests that makes walking in and out very easy. Overall- we had a great time. We barely left our "apartment for the weekend" and will definitely return to San Fran, specifically just to stay at Fairmont Heritage Place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Sherylshopper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 days here on our way back from Hawaii and we now know why this hotel is rated #1 on this site. My husband and I are frequent discerning travelers and we found this to be one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. The staff: Courteous and accommodating, everyone from management to housekeeping made us feel welcome and were all very polite. The suite: we were upgraded from a one to a two bedroom city view upon arrival and although when we booked we had wanted the sold out bay view, I doubt there's a bad room in the place. Previous reviews noted city views to be a bit noisy but we didn't find this to be the case at all. The suite was large and well appointed with top of the line appliances and amenities including Bosch washer and dryer. Full kitchen, plush robes, Ghirardelli chocolates, flat screen TVs in every room, a large modern bathroom in each bedroom, fireplace and fab surround sound system. Note, the pictures from the website were a very accurate depiction of the hotel. The experience: the billiards lounge offered continental breakfast in the morning and wine and snacks late afternoons. On our second day we were informed that a bay view suite would be available for our final night and scooped it up. The staff looked after transferring our belongings while we were out taking a tour of Alcatraz. The view from this suite was spectacular. The harbour, Hyde Street Pier, Alcatraz and of course Ghirardelli Square, great for people watching. The location: we were easily within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and the cruise boats; we did enjoy the use of the complimentary Maserati on our last night to go for a romantic dinner. It was also nice to have convenience stores right across the street from the hotel to purchase snacks and liquor and wine. As well there are great little shops right in the square along with some great restaurants. I bought rose petal jelly at Cellar360 and the ambiance and the food at McCormickâ€™s was great. The only regret my husband and I had about our stay at Fairmont Ghirardelli was that we didnâ€™t stay longer. Well done Fairmont, we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - the best we ever had”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights on our trip to San Francisco from Australia, and we absolutely loved it. From our arrival and check-in, to check-out, service was faultless and facilities were wonderful. We got a 2 bedroom apartment, with 2 bathrooms, and a fully equipped kitchen. All appliances were state of the art, and our room also had a Bosch washer and a separate dryer, which was really helpful. The apartment itself was very spacious, with large windows, automatic blinds, 3 large high-def LCD screens, cable TV with 100's of channels, DVD players - as well as a gas heater in the living area! We loved it so much we wished that we lived at Fairmong Heritage Place Ghirardelli Square. Also downstairs, there are 3 or 4 Ghirardelli chocolate cafe's and shops, which were fantastic. There are several restaurants as well as specialty shops at the Square, and it's only a short walk from the Fisherman's Wharf itself. Staff were fantastic, with the concierge doing everything he could to accommodate to our requests, from in-room dining, to arranging a in-residence masseuse for my wife. The Maserati town car was absolutely fantastic as well, as it took us to Union Square, shopping areas, or other restaurants that are a just a bit too far to walk to. There's a guest lounge area as well, with a high quality pool table and daily breakfast in the morning. We loved it, and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay whilst you can”
Reviews.Author: leisurely_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in bay facing two bed appartment. Terrific views modern state of the art fixtures and fittings. Ghirardelli is busy during day but quiet at night however you can buy a one day pass for the trams and go to the terminus two blocks away getting on and off all day - great fun. The block is really time share, oops, shared ownership !, and so when enough sold will cease to be hotel as well so stay - whilst you can. Enjoyed 4 p.m. cheese and biscuits but this is mainly for time share sales but free for guests as is pleasant complimenrary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: travelsharker
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip and miss the comfort of the Fairmont Heritage Place @ Ghirardelli Square. This is the most high-tech hotel room I've ever seen! Everything is new. The appliances are nice and the sound/tv/dvd system is great. Speakers and surround sound are integrated into the room. The staff made sure we had everything we needed....down to DVDs to watch at night. Everyone was friendly, helpful and attentive. The location is great....in a touristy, but pretty safe part of town. Our favorite thing was the linens...they were very soft and comfortable. We experienced some street noise on the second floor, but not enough to keep us awake. Being on a lower floor, our ocean view was partially obstructed by another building, but it wasn't a big problem. All in all, we had a great stay and would definitly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous at all levels”
Reviews.Author: MPK-Canada
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently in North America on business and leisure and this is one ot the top properties I've ever stayed at. We we upgraded to a 2-BR suite (a friend of my wife joined us. They toured while I attended a conference). The suite was terrific: full kitchen with touches like a wine fridge; each bedroom had its own full bathroom; and twice daily maid service. From the professionalism and courtesy of the staff to the Maserati Quattroporte (!) available currently to drive guests within a 2-mile radius, it was definitely not your usual hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary place, great service, incredible views.”
Reviews.Author: DMH154
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late September. We loved the place and prefer it to all the other hotels in San Francisco. We have tried: The Four Seasons (hated it-noisy, pretentious and noir.) The Mandarin Oriental: (like it a lot, second choice, but it is in the financial district, on the top floors of a high rise office building. Hard to get away from feeling like you are going to work. The Omni: Nice hotel, nice location, nice rooms. Bad service. The Fairmont Ghirardelli Square is an all-suites hotel that is an historic building. It has great charm and large windows (with incredible views.) The rooms are extraordinary, with fireplaces, bay views, kitchens, family rooms, marble baths, large flat screens in the bedrooms and family rooms. They provide a continental breakfast with fruit and berries each morning (for free!) and cheese and wine in the afternoon (also free!) Outside there are large open terraces (with gas fire pits) to hang out on on beautiful days - overlooking the bay and the plaza of Ghirardelli Square. A block and a half from Gary Denko's Restaurant, Fort Mason Park, and on the National Maritime Historic Park we walked all over the place. I particularly like the antique four-master docked in the Maritime Park. Waking up to see that every morning was terrific. Very strong recommendation. Hard to beat this place, anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: mariusssi
Reviews.Content: Really nice place, perfect service, just one problem: a little bit noisy, old windows - you can hear the street...

Reviews.Title: “This place is a knockout!!”
Reviews.Author: HolaLola56
Reviews.Content: I don't know what more I could add to the already rave reviews about the Fairmont Heritage! The location is great within easy access to transportation (MUNI bus, cable car, and streetcars), the staff and service is exceptional, the apartments are FABULOUS and comfortable...I would most definitely stay here again! A true gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stphnwhit6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FAirmont for threenight at the begining of our West Coast holday. The hotel is situated in a fabulous (if a little noisy) position and has been developed from the Ghiradelli chocolate factory. The development provides easy access to some restaurants, shops etc, allo fwhich are handy given thatthe hotel has neither a bar nor restaurant. Clearly there's been a lot of thought fiven to this development - we had a two bedroom room which would have been better described as an apartment. There's a fully fitted kitched and lounge with first class facilities including fantastic audio-visual kit should the legendary San Fran weather be too cool for an extended period outside. There's also an outside area with views across the bay to Alcatraz - the area has comfy seating and a lovely fire pit for the chilly evenings. When we stayed the spa was under construction and a licqour license had been applied for - once in place, this will probably be a fautless city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Land2Sea
Reviews.Content: We booked this two bedroom suite because we have three children and need the room. Most places can't even garantee connecting rooms. We also wanted to be within walking distanct to the popular attractions that we wanted to see within our two day window. The attention and service that was provided here was unmatched in any other hotel we have stayed in. Our "room" was actually a two floor mini apartment. It came complete with washer and dryer and kitchen. This hotel just finished renovations so it's in pristine condition. We had fantastic views from our room of Alcatraz and the bay. I would have stayed an additional night longer if I knew it would be so nice, we were just "passing by" on our way home from Hawaii. The complimentary breakfast with fresh fruits ad herbal teas started our day perfectly. Since there were bagels and cereal, the children were also thrilled. The nighttime atmosphere of the area is magnificent and they will light a roof top fire pit for you if requested. There is lovely seating areas with pits for you to choose, unfortunately we were too tired to do so. Did I mention the Giradelli chocolates placed on you pillows with night time turn down....need I say more!

Reviews.Title: “Number One Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Lady_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Four Seasons while in San Francisco; we thought we would try a different place and noticed that for less money, we got a one-bedroom suite complete with kitchen. I was expecting a good stay, and hoping that the service would match the top notch service at the Four Seasons. Overall, we were blown away by this property. I cannot say enough about the staff, who almost glow as it seems they love their jobs so much. Either that, or they are very good actors. Some taxi drivers still do not know about this place and we were taken to the other Fairmont by mistake, so give them the address in addition to the property name. The location is quite good, near the Russian Hill area, and many good restaurants are within a 15-20 minute walk. The (free!!!) house limo will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius, plus PICK YOU UP, which is almost unheard of. The property is stunning -- the pictures on their website do not do it justice. We were upgraded to a two-bedroom, but it was at ground level and by the makeshift gym (they are still working on the gym and Willow Stream Spa) and the exit out to Ghirardelli Square. So, during the day, it was fairly noisy --plenty of slamming doors, plus I don't think they put in triple pane windows as you can clearly hear conversations on the street of passersby, and street traffic. If you are on the Ghirardelli Square side, you have to deal with the noise from the nearby businesses and tourists. However, by evening, the noise is diminished quite significantly. We did not hear any noise from the other suites beside or above us. If you do not like big city noises, I would not recommend staying here. We found the bed in the master bedroom fairly soft (we like firm beds) and we moved into the second bedroom for the remainder of our stay as the bed seemed firmer. We asked the staff if they could put a board under the mattress, but that was the only request they could not accomodate. Both bathrooms were gorgeous, with plenty of soft, fluffy towels. Shower pressure could have been a bit stronger, and though high-end, the amentities were strongly scented with a men's cologne type fragrance, which was disappointing for me. The kitchen was extremely well equipped and what impressed me were all the high-end touches; Henckel knives, Cuisinart cookware, and Villeroy and Boch dishware, plus a Wolf gas range. They spared no expense outfitting these kitchens and I only wish I had time to cook during our stay. There was also a Bosch washer and dryer in the suite, so you can pack light and leave room in your suitcase instead for shopping. Detergent and dryer sheets are provided. There are two business centres with internet access (free for guests) and free Wifi throughout the property, though I found it very spotty in our suite. There are also two terraces with propane firepits which overlook Ghirardelli Square and the ocean. The daily wine and cheese is sponsored by the sales staff, and we appreciated that they were very discreet re: sales They seemed to notice when people weren't interested and were pleasant people to talk to, not pushy at all, plus gave us some good sightseeing tips. The continental breakfast is simple, but again, very high-end; fresh squeezed juice, Illy coffee, organic tea, Ghirardelli hot chocolate, organic yogurts, beautiful pastries, and plenty of cut-up fresh fruit. It made a great start to our day. If it seems like I'm raving about this place, I am! We would return in a heartbeat, trust me, it may seem pricey but for the service and amenities, it is really good value. This is going to be our new favorite hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! One of the best hotel stays we have had”
Reviews.Author: myvacay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in mid August. From the moment we arrived we felt pampered and well taken care of by the concierge and butler staff. The staff was always available to arrange great dining choices and to advise regarding activities. We took advantage of the hotel's complementary car. The rooms are spacious and extremely well appointed. The view from our huge deck was breathtaking. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “WOW-This place is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jod2la
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont after seeing the pictures on tripadvisor and reading the reviews. This place does not disappoint, simply one of the BEST experiences I've ever had at a hotel. The service, the staff, and the location are superb! on a scale of 1-10 it's an 11. Wine and cheese at 4-5pm, very nice. I was upgraded upon check in, Thank you very much. The place was HUGE, we were given a two bedroom residence, full kitchen, table for 6, Big living room surround sound and 2 private bedrooms. A touch noisy on the street. Butler service, amazing!, DVD movies and popcorn brought to your room. My only negative was the bed was too soft but I'm used to a hard bed. The house car is a Maserati, had to get a ride in that, first come first serve. You can walk to lots of shops and the cable car drops you right at Gharadilli square. We had a lovely meal at Mcormicks right next door. The concierge made us a reservation and we had a beautiful window table without even asking for it. Quite simply Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: srsam67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights...we had a gorgeous one bedroom suite with balcony and bay view (#314). It was also perfect for people watching as it overlooked the square. Some of you tourists really should not wear low cut shirts and shorts :) The room had a modern feel with a nicely stocked kitchen.
