We ate breakfast in everyday but the hotel also provides a complimentary continental breakfast. What set this place apart was the awesome service. The employees really seem to like their jobs and our sincere (as much as they can be while earning tips) in giving you the right information and best help. Plus my son loved the free chocolate :) The rooms are pricey but with the economy there are always specials. We paid an average of $400.00 a night and it was worth it. The hotel also provides a car service and is also convenient to the SF public transportation system. Restaurants close by can be touristy but I enjoyed a small sushi place on Hyde: Grandeho's Kamekyo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: ddingle
Reviews.Content: So I decided to take my whole family (Self, husband, daughter, mom and dad) on vacation. Kinda, I picked the hotel. So after talking with other travelers and reading reviews I thought Fairmont Ghiradelli Square would be the best fit for a variety of activities and people going. I WAS RIGHT! First off, the hotel is gorgeous and the service is top notch! I received an email from their concierge, Jeremy, a week before I was due out with contact information and any needs or requests I may have. (Which were none, but just the same). When I arrived Jeremy was there to greet us and made us all feel right at home. I booked a 2 bedroom city view which we were escorted to and given a run down of room and hotel amenities. The room was nicely appointed with spacious kitchen, dining and living area. There is one master bedroom with a king bed, separate shower and tub, robes and excellent linens (I let my parents have this room). The second bedroom also has a king bed with high thread count sheets. Shared bathroom has a walk in shower and large vanity. The room itself was great but there was quite a bit of street noise. The only downfall. (Opt for the bayview and you'll skip the traffic noise). There are 2 patios, one with a great view, both with firepits which are nice on a cold SF night! I think I spent a little time out there every night with a glass of wine or cup of tea! The hotel also offers a small gym, which I did not use, I was really on vacation and a great lounge area. The lounge had a pool table, which we did use almost every day. They offer a wine and cheese happy hour too. There is a spa going in, but was under construction when I was there (too bad). Lastly, location. You are AT Ghiradelli Square, literally, there is a back entrance that steps out to the square. You have a choice of many restaurants in your back yard. I highly recommend McCormick's & Kuletos, great seafood! Of course, chocolate and ice cream is steps away. Try a cupcake at Kara's too! Short walk from the hotel is the Cable Car turnaround, the bay and Maritime museum! Quick cab ride or bus ride anywhere! All and all, Stay there! The cost was comparable to anywhere near by and you couldn't ask for a better location! The staff really made it for me! They were attentive and really made you feel at home! Hope that gives you a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best, if not THE best, SF properties on offer”
Reviews.Author: candyflip69
Reviews.Content: Just finished 2 nights at the Ghirardelli, which was the most enjoyable 5 star experience I've had at any property Stateside. We had an incredible deal which meant we gave plenty of $$$ to the local wine store, chocolatier and restaurants. Not to mention the generous staff tips. Every cent was worth it. We enjoyed a 2 bedroom City view room which was larger than our apartment at home (bring earplugs if you are on this side as the traffic noise from outside can get slightly annoying at 6am weekdays). The rooms are superbly outiftted, the beds as comfortable as our one at home, and as President's Club Members we of course enjoyed excellent free breakfasts, free wirless internet and all newspapers each day. We had a floor butler assigned too, but didn't end up using him/her. And that Maserati towncar - nice! The hotel staff are also uniformly welcoming, friendly and professional. Can't really fault the place. If you can afford it, have a special occasion to celebrate, or can find a deal, don't hesitate for a minute to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know how you could beat it !!”
Reviews.Author: Honestly-2-U
Reviews.Content: Had a 1 bedroom on the second floor (#214) with huge balcony overlooking Alcatraz and Ghirardelli Square. Noise from below was never an issue. Room was in perfect condition, spotless clean. Service by all staff was excellent. Breakfast was not huge but was all you really need to start the day. Afternoon wine and cheese was very good. Location is perfect for access to all attractions. The use of the house car was a nice touch. We will be back as soon as possible !! Stay here, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: vacationmama
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to the glowing reviews below. We loved the Fairmont Heritage! Beutiful 2 bedroom unit with views of the bay and Alcatraz. Took advantage of the two firepits, the pool table, the extensive movie collection and the Maserati! The car was always availalbe, very rarely did we have to wait. Had the continental breakfast each morning, which was lovely, with many different kinds of fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, cereals, and yogurts. The pictures on the website are very representative of the hotel. Another plus (not for my waistline!) was the proximity to the Ghiradelli chocolate store. My teens went down every night and had a very large sundae and I frequently walked in for some free chocolate! There is also an absolutely delicious cupcake shop "Kara's Cupcakes", which is worth trying. We enjoyed the 360 Wine Celler which was in the square just steps away from our hotel. Great for purchasing wine, cheese, etc. What is really exceptional here is the high level of service by all members of the staff. Extremely polite, pleasant, and very helpful. We loved our stay. Check out their website for special rates.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Town!”
Reviews.Author: phyholt
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, service, breakfast, room, wine, and everything about the Fairmont. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. We had a city room on the first floor and never had any problem with noise. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. Also take advantage of the car it was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Touristy Location...Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: souts23
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: We were welcomed at the Fairmont Ghirardelli relatively late on a weeknight by the two concierge/check-in hosts who man the desks just inside the lobby. We got a quick tour of the property, which includes two terraces, one of which has a "fire pit" and daily wine/cocktail hours, as well as a lounge that serves a complimentary continental breakfast. The lobby is small but tastefully appointed, as are the common areas. The elevators are freight car size and quick and responsive. The Room: All of these "hotel rooms" were originally built as condominium units, and the size of each room is truly apartment like. Our one bedroom had a full chef's kitchen as you walk in, complete with Bosch dishwasher and Sub-Zero drawer fridge/freezer. A living area has a large exposed brick wall and large windows facing out onto SF Bay and Alcatraz. Flatscreen mounted TV with DirectTV and a surround sound system (there is probably $2000 of AV equipment built into the wall). The bedroom is a good size, with the same view and there is a large bathroom. The bathroom, however, was probably my only complaint about the room itself - there is a lot of wasted space that could have been used to create a larger shower or a sitting area, at least in my unit. More importantly, for one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in - this shower stunk. No door, so it was freezing when you weren't under the water - pressure was just so/so, as well. The beds were incredibly comfortable, as expected. Oh yeah, and a washer/dryer, which we used (they provide detergent and dryer sheets). The Perks: A concierge contacted me a few weeks in advance of our trip to see if I would need any help planning an itinerary. They were kind enough to book multiple lunch/dinner reservations as well as a guided wine tour through Napa. New York Times delivered to the door every day. House Car (Maserati) which will take you anywhere within 2 miles of the hotel if it is available, and it was every time we needed it. Chocolates on the pillow (Ghirardelli, natch) and they will do grocery shopping for you in advance of your arrival (if you want them to pick up a bottle of wine, etc.). 500 movie DVD library which we took advantage of on a night we stayed in. Hotel Location: Ghirardelli Square is very touristy, next to Fisherman's Wharf. It is not a happening part of town, and gets quiet early at night.

Reviews.Title: “Have recommended it to friends already - Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: deborahmucb
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in - and we've been to many 5+ star properties over the years! We originally booked for 1 wk and extended it for a 2nd week. The property is beautiful and so nicely appointed. The units have high ceilings, original brick- accented walls, lots of natural light, exquisite and beautifully-equipped kitchen, very comfortable beds and the most comfortable pillows and softest sheets you've ever slept on! There are several very nice and expansive decks with views of Alcatraz and the GG Bridge. There is a gas fireplace that is lit every afternoon - wonderful place to sip wine and visit or read. The staff couldn't be nicer or more professioinal. And, the complimentary house car will take you anywhere you want to go within several miles of the hotel. The location is really fun - Ghirardelli Square has been totally revamped over the last several years by its new owners. Good restaurants, classy shops, 2 excellent wine bars, and a very nice ambience throughout. And, the proximity to the Bay with very nice walking trails, Fisherman's Wharf with all of its excellent seafood, and the cable cars make the Fairmont Heritage Place a primo spot. It is also a close walk to Polk Street in Russian Hill where there are lots of good shops and restaurants. We'd recommend one restaurant in particular - "Street" on Polk. Intimate, fun restaurant with excellent, fresh CA cuisine, moderately priced. We had a wonderful time at Fairmont Heritage Place at Ghirardelli Square and can't wait to go back. And, they welcome small dogs - an added plus.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Room Ever!”
Reviews.Author: ToddsVacations
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom city view, the nicest hotel room we've ever stayed in. The room was huge, bigger than our own home. The full kitchen and dining area were very nice and perfect for warming up leftovers from our dinner at Fisherman's Wharf. The location is amazing, within walking distance of everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys quality and excellent service. We liked it so much we're going back next weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling!”
Reviews.Author: ktbro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best for a San Francisco sightseeing vacation! First, the accommodations - absolutely beautiful. From the Sub Zero refridgerator, Bosch washing machine and dryer, to the spacious bedrooms this condo was nicer than our house! Complimentary car service (a Maserati) to take you to places a little too far to walk. We especially appreciated the collection of over 500 complimentary DVDs (with DVD players in all the rooms) since our 2 year old goes to bed at 7:30. The hotel is almost brand new and was spotless. The service was very attentive and helpful. Even though our room was on the ground floor facing the street, the windows have some AMAZING noise insulation making it very quiet. Second, the location - it is, itself, a tourist attraction since it is the old Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory. The decks have views of the Golden Gate bridget and Alcatraz. It is right across the street from a beach and National Park, 1 block from the main cable car line (ride early to avoid the 1+ hour wait!), and a short walk to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, and the aquarium. We walked just about everywhere with our 2 year old in tow. This hotel is in a VERY touristy part of town so if you are looking for great shopping or a quaint vacation, you might look elsewhere, but for a family vacation it was perfect. Dining at the hotel is mostly chains (a diner and a steakhouse) but the full kitchen and beautiful dining area made us want to eat in anyway! The only drawback is that the Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop gives out free chocolate samples which were just too hard to resist. I gained way too much weight on this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: DEVIK
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site and researching the hotels in SF I finally decided on this one...and it was truly unbelievable. My kids who are used to staying at top class hotels were impressed too; and you know it is not easy to impress teenagers!! We were upgraded to a two bedroom apartment and we absolutely loved it. The location is great, the sevice was superb and the apartment itself was fabulous. This was one of our nicest vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: swanney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Heritage Place for six nights during our girls spring break. The place is awesome. We stayed on the Mustard Terrace in a two bedroom with views of the Bay and Alcatraz.. There was a fire pit right outside our door that we enjoyed every night. The staff here was wonderful. We loved the convenience of the location. We walked everywhere! The continental breakfast was great.My girls thought this was the neatest place they had ever stayed. We will go back to this hotel anytime we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this... great place to stay in a great city”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaVagabond
Reviews.Content: We just had the pleasure of spending 4 wonderful days in this fantastic property. The worst part of the trip was checking out and having to leave. It really feels like a home away from home. We have stayed at over a dozen Fairmonts and this is our favourite. However, this is not a place for rug rats. There is no pool with slides or restaurants with crayons and balloons.The staff are wonderful especially the concierge department. We were able to get a reservation at Gary Dankos with only 2 days notice, thanks to Kari the concierge. The location is great and the complimentary Maserati Quattroporte was something else. I can't wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Casual luxury with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Leila290
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful and the staff most helpful and went out of their way to suggest visits that meet my son's passions. We stayed at the Ghiradelli for 6 nights, and in spite of terrible weather, the hotel made the visit to San Francisco a real treat. The spacious kitchen was beautifully is appointed with state of the art appliances, a bonus for foodies. The location, as with most Fairmont hotel was ideal and the residence hotel offered wonderful and comfortable space. It became a home rather than a hotel. Should we return to San Francisco, I would not even look at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better than this!”
Reviews.Author: CCAAlamo
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend with my 85 year old mother, and my best friend from So. Calif. We shared a two bedroom unit and it was the perfect location for us. We explored the plaza and shops, and especially liked the wine and tea shops. What a fun place. The rooms are fabulous!!! They are sleek and classy and have everything you would need to entertain or conduct a business meeting. Wonderful linens on the beds and in the bathrooms, the staff is very attentive and friendly, but not over bearing. We enjoyed the complimentary afternoon wine and cheese on the Mustard Terrace overlooking the bay and Ghirardelli Square, with views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. They even drove us to dinnwe in onw of the complimentary town cars!!! I really don't think it can get much better than this, they have thought of everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy independence”
Reviews.Author: MrsPofLancashire
Reviews.Content: Having searched reviews for many hotels in San Francisco I couldn't really find the right balance of style, location, service and price, until finding the Fairmont Heritage Place by accident on a holiday rental sight. The hotel is very classy, apartments are spacious, well designed and very well equipped, the kitchens have every mod con you could imagine, the decor is subtle, modern but still in keeping with the heritage of the building. We also had a large terrace overlooking the square and the bay. My only criticism would be that the shower was a bit wimpy. Continental breakfast was handy, and the afternoon cheese and wine hour was a restful hour to while away or play pool. The location of the hotel is great, walking distance from most neighborhoods (Russian Hill is great for restaurants and 7 blocks away, downhill on the way back). Check-in and concierge servers couldn't have been more helpful and the hotel car is very handy. Will definitely stay again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: miamipickytravelers
Reviews.Content: We liked the Fairmont in Ghiradelli Square so much that we changed our reservation at another hotel on our return trip to stay a 2nd time. Big, brand new rooms with kitchen, living and bedroom. Flat screens, fire place and a great staff. Look for web rates - a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. It is located at Ghiradelli square and right by the wharf. The rooms all have kitchens/living area's and washer/dryers. It's a home away from home. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the bay views are great. Included in your stay is continental breakfast and a car service within a 2 mile radius. They also do a wine hour in the evening. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are very large and set up in 1/2/3 bedroom units. The tv's and stereo system is very high tech with surround sound, etc. This is a great place to stay, you will wish you didnt have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Ghirardelli is True Gem”
Reviews.Author: rluna68
Reviews.Content: A true gem of a property in a historic building overlooking San Francisco Bay. One of the best vantage points from where to see Alcatraz, Tiburon and Sausalito. The hotel consists of four buildings surrounded by some excellent restaurants, shops and attractions. The rooms feature kitchens with mini-Wolf stoves, Sub Zero refrigerators, Bosch washers/dryers and an awesome surround sound setup in living rooms AND bedrooms. Continental breakfast and afternoon wine / cheese add to the flair of this truly unique property. Moreover, Gary Danko will soon open up a restaurant on the property and their menu will be available as room service for the property guests on china from the restaurant. Service is by far the best I've seen in a long time. In fact, you can order groceries from most any local vendor and have it stocked prior to your arrival. Imagine having fresh dungeoness crab waiting in your room directly from Fisherman's Wharf. The property has one, two and three bedroom lofts all decorated in a unique modern style - it reminded me of some of the better items you can purchase at the Pottery Barn. Mattresses only add to the flair - Stearn and Foster matresses specifically designed for the Fairmont! Slept like a baby. The property is in the old Ghiradelli Square building - you can't get any more San Francisco than that. Additionally, you're close to North Beach and downtown. In fact, they'll drive you anywhere within a two mile radius in the properties Maserati sedan! A must see to believe propery with rates comprable to room only hotels in San Francisco. One of the best values for your money. I highly recommend you see this property. I work in the travel industry and have seen some real nice properties (paradors in Spain, etc.). I was very impressed by the property and (moreso) by the professionalism and attention to detail by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “New Property can turn into a gem with time”
Reviews.Author: Travellady22
Reviews.Content: We on our annual trip to the Hawaiian Islands and we always stop over in San Francisco on way back to DC. We enjoy 4 and 5 star hotels, we have stayed at the Fairmont, Huntington, Hyatt, and several Kimptons. This time we had our 33 year old son, who wanted his own bedroom and bathroom. Since this was a family trip over Thanksgiving, we wanted a 2 bedroom suite, with a living room, and possible kitchen. I found this brand new Fairmont Residence Hotel with fractional ownership, which also sells its units now nightly to the public. We could find NO reviews of any type,as it had really just opened this past August, but we decided to gamble and try it. Good points: Brand new, immaculate, 3 flat screen tv's, living room, and each bedroom. Lovely sheets and beds, great bathrooms, separate showers and bathtubs, modern furniture, table for 6 in the kitchen dining room, dream kitchen, washer and dryer, etc. Nice first floor breakfast room with free continental breakfast served from 7am to 10am, and nightly wine and cheese from 5pm to 6pm. Also 2 free computer rooms in lobby. Staff very pleasant and a Maserati sedan to drop you within a 2 mile radius to restaurants and shopping if you can get it. Two great terraces overlooking the Bay with fire pits and lots of chairs outside for guests to sit outside with their own wine (no bar in hotel, but wine shops below in plaza This hotel does NOT have a restaurant but does have limited room service from some restaurants below in the plaza. The possible down sides: Not for people with walking problems. As you have 5 buildings connected by stairs, long halls, walkways, etc. For those who like to come back to the hotel and have a drink at the bar, or have a small cafe or restaurant, it has NONE. There seem to be a lot of different floor plans. Our unit had a terrace bay view all right, but the view was blocked by a gazebo with tables and chairs.. Our unit ran from front to back, as many there do,, and the two bedrooms were on the street, bus, cab, truck, people noise. The units have a lot of huge windows 12 feet high and NOT double paned. You can hear everything outside from some lower units, ask for a high floor if possible. The place is built right into a new shopping and dining plaza, below you. Rooms with bay view hear all this below. Our building and terrace was over a Gary Danko Restaurant which is opening in Spring 2009. That could be noisy also. The staff is pleasant, but clearly finding its way still in this new property. Finding the front door first time is a challenge. Summary: The guests we met were intelligent, articulate, quiet, with pretty well behaved children and dogs. The hotel inside is quiet. When the summer tourist crowd is below in the plaza and all the shops and restaurants are open, the noise level will increase and how it will effect many suites, I do not know. Over all, we liked it for our needs, It is not for everyone, the location is not central, and the area across the street is still dicey with a garish liquor store across from the hotel entrance. However, it is up and coming area, and they did a nice job of redoing the old Ghiradelli chocolate factory buildings. The minor complaints most guests agreed on, noise through their windows from the street or plaza, wanted more good small dining choices in that area, wifi would work in all rooms (ours did not)and that the hotel had its breakfast cafe open till 11pm. The restaurants in the Plaza below are nice, but not many of them, the all seem to stop serving or close by 10pm except for one bar which is a bit rowdy. Since they have that lovely room for breakfast, that stays empty the rest of the day and night, they should sell soup, salad, and nice sandwiches for guests till midnight. And if you arrive there after 10:30pm, there is NO place nearby open to eat or order from room service, nothing. As we found out our first night when our flight arrived late. They only have "room service" from the few dining spots in the plaza" and those were closing. I was not offered a menu. So, I would highly suggest to them that they use their "breakfast room" for all day and evening snacks. We would have eaten bagels, juice, tea, apples, bananas, sandwich, anything, when we finally arrived at 10:48pm. They did not suggest a thing. From a property touting 5 star service this is not acceptable. They have food in their mini kitchen, for breakfast and the wine and cheese hour, they could have offered at least apples, oranges, juice, cheese, something. They did not. We give this new place a low 4 star and when all the plaza construction is done and new hotel bugs get worked out, we want to return again PS A sandwich plate, cheese platter, cookies, juice, tea in our room, which we would have paid for, would have been welcome. Instead of "everything in this area is not serving meals at this hour"

HotelInfo.Name: Fairmont Heritage Place, Ghirardelli Square
HotelInfo.Address: 900 North Point Street, Suite D100, San Francisco, CA 94109
